commit_message:
Fix omission of request_ids returned to user

ManagerWithFind's find() and findall() function is exposed to users
as ManagerWithFind is parent class of VolumeManager, SnapshotManager,
etc.

When the find() and findall() function is called by users, they should
also return request_ids to users.

Change-Id: I87dca61f96ff9cf4dc9a443a46d7f559e8b3026f
Closes-Bug: 1545975
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-cinderclient refs/changes/51/280551/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Change ignore-errors to ignore_errors

Needed for coverage 4.0

Conflicts:
        .coveragerc

NOTE(mriedem): The conflict is due to the precision option
not being used in the report group in kilo.

Change-Id: Iee7cb612860f18206888cdb3661e03c25d7ff96c
(cherry picked from commit 9ae5a4b7ab50e61af79938af0b84f275fed7c051)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sahara refs/changes/11/273011/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ignore_errors = True

commit_message:
Enhance py2pkg filter for version and epoch handling

Some distros use epochs for package versions and some don't.
The py2pkg filter can now handle versions and epochs. py2pkg
can now also be called as function inside of a template. The old
style usage like

Requires:       {{ 'oslo.config' | py2pkg }} >= 3.0.0

still works but this will be in the future

Requires:       {{ py2pkg('oslo.config', ('>=', '3.0.0')) }}

or, also possible but not recommended,

Requires:       {{ 'oslo.config' | py2pkg(('>=', '3.0.0')) }}

Together with an epoch yaml file, which should look like:

---
epochs:
  oslo.config: 1
  oslo.context: 5

The example would automatically render to:

Requires: python-oslo.config >= 1:3.0.0

To support all the mentioned features, the code needed some
restructuring:

- use contextfunction and contextfilter decorators for the filters.
  With that we can pass variables to the filters and functions. Used for
  the spec style and the epochs
- restructure the functions to make it easier testable
- test all new code and also create tests for the currently used
  style of calling py2pkg

Change-Id: I11670c5b5df2d37de02adffe08e35b073dda90fa

Environment() renderspec._env_register_filters(self.env) def test_render_py2pkg_oldstyle(self): template = self.env.from_string("{{ 'requests' | py2pkg }} >= 2.8.1") self.assertEqual( template.render(spec_style='suse', epochs={}), 'python-requests >= 2.8.1') def test_render_py2pkg(self): template = self.env.from_string( "{{ 'requests' | py2pkg }}") self.assertEqual( template.render(spec_style='suse', epochs={}), 'python-requests') def test_render_py2pkg_with_version(self): template = self.env.from_string( "{{ 'requests' | py2pkg(('>=', '2.8.1')) }}") self.assertEqual( template.render(spec_style='suse', epochs={}), 'python-requests >= 2.8.1') def test_render_py2pkg_with_version_and_epoch(self): template = self.env.from_string( "{{ 'requests' | py2pkg(('>=', '2.8.1')) }}") self.assertEqual( template.render(spec_style='suse', epochs={'requests': '1'}), 'python-requests >= 1:2.8.1') class RenderspecFilterTests(unittest.TestCase): def test_filter_license_spdx(self): self.assertEqual( renderspec._filter_license_spdx( {'spec_style': 'suse'}, 'Apache-2.0'), 'Apache-2.0' ) self.assertEqual( renderspec._filter_license_spdx( {'spec_style': 'fedora'}, 'Apache-2.0'), 'ASL 2.0' ) def test_filter_python_module2package_pgkname_only(self): self.assertEqual( renderspec._filter_python_module2package( {'spec_style': 'suse', 'epochs': {}}, 'oslo.config'), 'python-oslo.config' ) self.assertEqual( renderspec._filter_python_module2package( {'spec_style': 'fedora', 'epochs': {}}, 'oslo.config'), 'python-oslo-config' ) def test_filter_python_module2package_pgkname_and_version(self): self.assertEqual( renderspec._filter_python_module2package( {'spec_style': 'suse', 'epochs': {}}, 'oslo.config', ('>=', '1.2.3')), 'python-oslo.config >= 1.2.3' ) self.assertEqual( renderspec._filter_python_module2package( {'spec_style': 'fedora', 'epochs': {}}, 'oslo.config', ('==', '1.2.3~a0')), 'python-oslo-config == 1.2.3~a0' ) def test_filter_python_module2package_pgkname_and_version_and_epoch(self): self.assertEqual( renderspec._filter_python_module2package( {'spec_style': 'suse', 'epochs': {'oslo.config': '4'}}, 'oslo.config', ('>=', '1.2.3')), 'python-oslo.config >= 4:1.2.3' ) def test_filter_python_module2package_pgkname_and_epoch_no_version(self): self.assertEqual( renderspec._filter_python_module2package( commit_message:
[zmq] Implement Response and Envelope classes

Currently we get a property from zmq reply/envelope through a dict
operating, for more easily accessing its properties, let's add
Response and Envelope classes and reduce dicts in our messages.

This patch will make the code more concise such as:
  reply[zmq_names.FIELD_FAILURE] => reply.failure

Change-Id: I9ca7e4bee404ca8e658163827d958b69b05a16ae

deleted_lines: msg_type = envelope[zmq_names.FIELD_MSG_TYPE] target = envelope[zmq_names.FIELD_TARGET] message_id = envelope[zmq_names.FIELD_MSG_ID] if msg_type not in zmq_names.MULTISEND_TYPES: raise zmq_publisher_base.UnsupportedSendPattern(msg_type) topic_filter = zmq_address.target_to_subscribe_filter(target) {"message_id": message_id, "target": target,

subject: Add etcd troubleshooting
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-22 21:07:16.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/magnum/commit/b6036f0e59c59b0713f65efcc4389811eb3e91a2', 'message': 'Add etcd troubleshooting

Add section on etcd to troubleshooting guide.

etcd provides key/value pair storage and management for
many services in the COE, therefore if it fails, many
other services will be failing also.  In some cases, the
secondary failures can be rather mysterious, for instance
kube-apiserver will simply fail to start with no specific
error message.

This section covers the basic failure scenario and gives some
pointers to verify the correct configuration, operation.

Partially implements:  blueprint magnum-troubleshooting-guide
Change-Id: I602a9c3b8e54796c72848cf945107a319e45b973

commit_message:
Add etcd troubleshooting

Add section on etcd to troubleshooting guide.

etcd provides key/value pair storage and management for
many services in the COE, therefore if it fails, many
other services will be failing also.  In some cases, the
secondary failures can be rather mysterious, for instance
kube-apiserver will simply fail to start with no specific
error message.

This section covers the basic failure scenario and gives some
pointers to verify the correct configuration, operation.

Partially implements:  blueprint magnum-troubleshooting-guide
Change-Id: I602a9c3b8e54796c72848cf945107a319e45b973
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/58/283258/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: The etcd service is used by many other components for key/value pair management, therefore if it fails to start, these other components will not be running correctly either. Check that etcd is running on the master nodes by:: service etcd status If is is running correctly, you should see that the service is successfully deployed:: Active: active (running) since .... If the daemon is not running, the status will show the service as failed, something like:: Active: failed (Result: timeout) In this case, try restarting etcd by:: sudo service etcd start If etcd continues to fail, check the following: - etcd requires discovery, and the default discovery method is the public discovery service provided by etcd.io; therefore, a common cause of failure is that this public discovery service is not reachable. Check by running on the master nodes:: source /etc/sysconfig/heat-params curl $ETCD_DISCOVERY_URL You should receive something like:: {"action":"get", "node":{"key":"/_etcd/registry/00a6b00064174c92411b0f09ad5466c6", "dir":true, "nodes":[ {"key":"/_etcd/registry/00a6b00064174c92411b0f09ad5466c6/7d8a68781a20c0a5", "value":"10.0.0.5=http://10.0.0.5:2380", "modifiedIndex":978239406, "createdIndex":978239406}], "modifiedIndex":978237118, "createdIndex":978237118} } The list of node IP's is created by Magnum, therefore it should match the current IP of the master nodes. If the public discovery service is not reachable, check the `Cluster internet access`_. - Check the log for etcd:: sudo journalctl -u etcd

commit_message:
Fix docs warnings

This commit fixes docs warnings when building docs. The installation and
usage documents are in README. So we don't need the entry in index.rst.
And _static directory is needed because it is declared in conf.py.

Change-Id: Ia34c2332a1099c5e181e9f27f472aae05c698431

commit_message:
Three ways to set Thin/Thick Type in Huawei driver

1.If thin_provisioning is set in the share type extra-specs,
  it will be used(thin share will be created if "capabilities:
  thin_provisioning=<is> True", thick share will be created if
  "capabilities:thin_provisioning=<is> False")
2.If "thin_provisioning" is not present in the share_type, the config value
  of "AllocType" in the config file will be used(thin share will be created
  if "AllocType=Thin", thick share will be created if "AllocType=Thick")
3.If two of aboves are not present, then thick share will be created by default.

Change-Id: I8153aa79fb04a4221675d7ec2e4b24947ec6f9d7
Closes-Bug: #1542133

commit_message:
LeftHand: Updating minimum client version

Updated HPE LeftHand driver to have a minimum client

commit_message:
Revert "Support `truncated` flag returned by identity service"

This reverts commit 870be44c0ed5564101f9cf9d53e8085fb01680c8.

This change breaks end users of the library. See:

http://logs.openstack.org/50/285450/1/check/gate-shade-dsvm-functional-keystone2/d1093b5/console.html#_2016-02-26_20_49_32_928

For an example of a consumer of the library being broken.

Change-Id: I1912003afb89579eb869767db7a411c451bc9806

added_lines: def encode(self, entity): if isinstance(entity, dict): return {self.key: entity} if isinstance(entity, list): return {self.collection_key: entity} def test_list(self, ref_list=None, expected_path=None, expected_query=None, **filter_kwargs): json=self.encode(ref_list))
deleted_lines: def encode(self, entity, truncated=None): encoded = {} if truncated is not None: encoded['truncated'] = truncated if isinstance(entity, dict): encoded[self.key] = entity return encoded if isinstance(entity, list): encoded[self.collection_key] = entity return encoded def _test_list(self, ref_list=None, expected_path=None, expected_query=None, truncated=None, **filter_kwargs): # We want to catch all cases: when `truncated` is not returned by the # server, when it's False and when it's True. # Attribute `truncated` of the returned list-like object should exist # in all these cases. It should be False if the server returned a list # without the flag. expected_truncated = False if truncated: expected_truncated = truncated json=self.encode(ref_list, truncated=truncated)) self.assertEqual(expected_truncated, returned_list.truncated) def test_list(self, ref_list=None, expected_path=None, expected_query=None, **filter_kwargs): # test simple list, without any truncation self._test_list(ref_list, expected_path, expected_query, **filter_kwargs) # test when a server returned a list with truncated=False self._test_list(ref_list, expected_path, expected_query, truncated=False, **filter_kwargs) # test when a server returned a list with truncated=True self._test_list(ref_list, expected_path, expected_query, truncated=True, **filter_kwargs)

Remove the table attributes which have been dropped

Those attributes are dropped and migrated to `local_user` and
`password` tables.

Closes-Bug: #1550110

commit_message:
Fix building on gentoo hosts

This patch fixes the profile autodetect.  If the profile was passed at install
time, it would overridden by the environment.d script.  This was fixed by
accepting the value passed by the user, if one was passed.

The enviroment.d file is run outside of chroot, because of this eselect will
not be available on non-gentoo systems.  We change the behavior to work
elsewhere, it was not working on non-gentoo systems and giving bad results on
gentoo systems (returing values from the host, not the guest being built).

This patch also fixes shm detection by checking if it is mounted already.

Change-Id: Ie58d8e19529a731bfbc9eeb4bb246988d1aaa772

commit_message:
RequestContext use oslo.context's to/from_dict

oslo.context's RequestContext provides a to_dict, use it
to take advantage of common behavior.

Change-Id: Ib33e576d951cc99aac9533a8698b58888c51d021

commit_message:
Expose extras information in requirements

Starting with oslo.db+Nova, we would like to specify say
oslo.db[fixtures] in Nova's test-requirements. If you see
the proposed review I4131e534d4cb12e4888d398fa4fb7c922e369210
the gate-nova-requirements fails because code in
project-config/jenkins/scripts/project-requirements-change.py
does not understand extras at all and treats both oslo.db
and oslo.db[fixtures] the same. Since that module
uses requirement.py, we should expose the information here
first and then fix project-config after that.

Change-Id: I146baa3ef94cc8bbf29af371786f3ea95a42cb9f
(cherry picked from commit 33636c1d81d2b03baafe8deb1669e11bfa77ee8d)

commit_message:
Add checks for setup.cfg existence in project dictionary

This check is needed by new projects at their first commit
Without this fix the following initial commit for new project
failed:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/201701/

The exception that it failed was originated in this method
with KeyError on the project['setup.cfg'] (see previous
jenkins logs on the above commit)

Log: http://logs.openstack.org/01/201701/6/check/gate-kuryr-requirements/e922983/console.html

Change-Id: I39db2918ea277b939f67d3c856f52bd53c226f27
(cherry picked from commit 97ddc985abe0e00b20595c5cc9d664c479fa8b41)

commit_message:
Add location to requirement.Requirement

This will provide space to store the result of parsing requirements
like -e file:///opt/stack/new/oslo.THING, which we need to do for
edit-constraint to work in devstack when more than one library is
being installed from git. This is a separate patch to make reviewing
the actual new functionality easier - it is entirely mechanical,
adding the field and dealing with test fallout.

Change-Id: Ied4e92717b0dab871dac42ae639d1f2a6c236414

commit_message:
Fix editing constraints files with urls in them.

constraints files, unlike global_requirements, need to be able to
contain urls (specifically file:/// paths) so that we can constrain
libraries to be run from their git trees, rather than having them flap
all over the place as different servers specify different bounds. The
first edit-constraints implementation failed to parse such lines,
throwing errors instead.

This patch makes the support for urls optional, preventing changing
the semantics of requirements update.py logic.

Change-Id: I33bd2d9dff9cb7dc1a50177db7286b7317966784
Depends-On: I0f07858e96ea3baf46f8a453e253b9ed29c7f7e2
(cherry picked from commit 63e574700196743d764ebcd538d55114a1ff231a)

added_lines: import reurl_re = re.compile( '^(?P<url>\s*(?:-e\s)?\s*(?:(?:git+)?https|http|file)://.*)' '#egg=(?P<name>[-\w]+)') def parse(content, permit_urls=False): return to_dict(to_reqs(content, permit_urls=permit_urls)) def parse_line(req_line, permit_urls=False): :param permit_urls: If True, urls are parsed into Requirement tuples. By default they are not, because they cannot be reflected into setuptools kwargs, and thus the default is conservative. When urls are permitted, -e *may* be supplied at the start of the line. # Don't find urls that are in comments. if '://' in req_line[:hash_pos]: if permit_urls: # We accept only a subset of urls here - they have to have an egg # name so that we can tell what project its for without doing # network access. Egg markers use a fragment, so we need to pull # out url from the entire line. m = url_re.match(req_line) name = m.group('name') location = m.group('url') parse_start = m.end('name') hash_pos = req_line[parse_start:].find('#') if hash_pos < 0: hash_pos = end else: hash_pos = hash_pos + parse_start else: # Trigger an early failure before we look for ':' pkg_resources.Requirement.parse(req_line) else: parse_start = 0 location = '' semi_pos = req_line.find(';', parse_start, hash_pos) colon_pos = req_line.find(':', parse_start, hash_pos) req_line = req_line[parse_start:marker_pos] if parse_start: # We parsed a url before specifier = '' elif req_line: # Pulled out a requirement # Comments / blank lines etc. return Requirement(name, location, specifier, markers, comment) location = req.location + '#egg=' if req.location else '' lines.append('%s%s%s%s%s\n' % ( location, package, req.specifiers, marker, comment))def _pass_through(req_line, permit_urls=False): if permit_urls: return (req_line.startswith('http://tarballs.openstack.org/') or req_line.startswith('-f')) else: return (req_line.startswith('http://tarballs.openstack.org/') or req_line.startswith('-e') or req_line.startswith('-f')) def to_reqs(content, permit_urls=False): if _pass_through(req_line, permit_urls=permit_urls): yield parse_line(req_line, permit_urls=permit_urls), content_line
deleted_lines: def parse(content): return to_dict(to_reqs(content)) def parse_line(req_line): if '://' in req_line[:hash_pos]: # Trigger an early failure before we look for ':' pkg_resources.Requirement.parse(req_line) semi_pos = req_line.find(';', 0, hash_pos) colon_pos = req_line.find(':', 0, hash_pos) req_line = req_line[:marker_pos] if req_line: return Requirement(name, '', specifier, markers, comment) lines.append('%s%s%s%s\n' % (package, req.specifiers, marker, comment))def _pass_through(req_line): return (req_line.startswith('http://tarballs.openstack.org/') or req_line.startswith('-e') or req_line.startswith('-f')) def to_reqs(content): if _pass_through(req_line): yield parse_line(req_line), content_line

commit_message:
Deal with underscores in names in edit-constraints

Problem showed up with django_openstack_auth job that installs from
source. The change to devstack to verify LIBS_FROM_GIT kicked in
(Iffef2007f99a0e932b68c4c897ebbfb748cac2b4) and starting failing the
job. The problem was that the edit_constraint was not fixing the
django-openstack-auth line in upperconstraints.txt as the setup.cfg
had name = django_openstack_auth. Note that when things finally get
installed setup_tools' safe_name kicks in to standardize names and for
example glance_store will show up as glance-store in pip freeze. So we
should be able to treat this situation better and allow constraints to
have the safe names (using dashes).

Conflicts:
	openstack_requirements/tests/test_requirement.py

 - 43a876b was not backported since kilo doesn't use upper-constraints.

Co-Authored-By: Robert Collins <rbtcollins@hp.com>
Change-Id: Ibaa22657a2cf2c0ad96dbd0b9bc43cdafe6a1d56
(cherry picked from commit 3ebedf84f03180fa8b212c53db7fe28bc577178b)

commit_message:
Expose extras information in requirements

Starting with oslo.db+Nova, we would like to specify say
oslo.db[fixtures] in Nova's test-requirements. If you see
the proposed review I4131e534d4cb12e4888d398fa4fb7c922e369210
the gate-nova-requirements fails because code in
project-config/jenkins/scripts/project-requirements-change.py
does not understand extras at all and treats both oslo.db
and oslo.db[fixtures] the same. Since that module
uses requirement.py, we should expose the information here
first and then fix project-config after that.

Conflicts:
	openstack_requirements/tests/test_requirement.py

- 43a876b was not backported since kilo doesn't use upper-constraints

Change-Id: I146baa3ef94cc8bbf29af371786f3ea95a42cb9f
(cherry picked from commit 33636c1d81d2b03baafe8deb1669e11bfa77ee8d)
(cherry picked from commit 41e11ea110820bb7eac0e93aa3522ba10d2b76e4)

fix default handling for pypi link

'no'.

commit_message:
Allow to use project_name in handler formats

This change enables project name use in nova_fixed/neutron notification
handler formats through %(project)s

Change-Id: I648641ed3de143b1228e0933fdee1d51f3cb3b83

subject: Add an on-demand single-target sync method
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-29 23:42:30.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/designate/commit/b2dc4c07e43fada283a03448f7f6dcb4e46626ae', 'message': 'Add an on-demand single-target sync method

- Adds `target_sync`, a method invoked only via RPC (probably)
by an admin API call. That somewhat intelligently replays all
the changes from a specific timestamp (serial #) on a given target.
- This came about from the following situation:
I run N number of nameservers, and I don't want all my zones going
to ERROR if I have to take one out of rotation of an emergency.
I want to be able to set my threshold percentage at N-1/100,
and sync back up all the changes that have happened while I was
doing maintenance. Unfortunately, Designate's periodic_recovery,
nor periodic_sync would work well for this method. Recovery only
fixes ERRORs, and sync simply sends NOTIFYs (and is too deeply
entombed in spaghetti code to be dug out) and is run automatically
on a set time interval, for a specific number of seconds, for all
targets.
- Includes a very simple Admin API call that looks like:
```json
POST /admin/target_sync

{
    "target_id": "f02a0c72-c701-4ec2-85d7-197b30992ce9",
    "timestamp": 1454071711
}

{
    "message": "Syncing 79 zones on f02a0c72-c701-4ec2-85d7-197b30992ce9"
}
```

Change-Id: I3e3b608049a67b2258cd05d208af46f19df8cbdb

commit_message:
Add an on-demand single-target sync method

- Adds `target_sync`, a method invoked only via RPC (probably)
by an admin API call. That somewhat intelligently replays all
the changes from a specific timestamp (serial #) on a given target.
- This came about from the following situation:
I run N number of nameservers, and I don't want all my zones going
to ERROR if I have to take one out of rotation of an emergency.
I want to be able to set my threshold percentage at N-1/100,
and sync back up all the changes that have happened while I was
doing maintenance. Unfortunately, Designate's periodic_recovery,
nor periodic_sync would work well for this method. Recovery only
fixes ERRORs, and sync simply sends NOTIFYs (and is too deeply
entombed in spaghetti code to be dug out) and is run automatically
on a set time interval, for a specific number of seconds, for all
targets.
- Includes a very simple Admin API call that looks like:
```json
POST /admin/target_sync

{
    "target_id": "f02a0c72-c701-4ec2-85d7-197b30992ce9",
    "timestamp": 1454071711
}

{
    "message": "Syncing 79 zones on f02a0c72-c701-4ec2-85d7-197b30992ce9"
}
```

Change-Id: I3e3b608049a67b2258cd05d208af46f19df8cbdb

added_lines: from __future__ import print_function import sys import tracebackfrom testtools.runtest import MultipleExceptions def setUp(self): # Sometimes, exceptions are raised in _setUp methods on fixtures. # testtools pushes the exception into a MultipleExceptions object along # with an artificial SetupError, which produces bad error messages. # This just logs those stack traces to stderr for easier debugging. try: super(BaseFixture, self).setUp() except MultipleExceptions as e: for i, exc_info in enumerate(e.args): print('--- printing MultipleExceptions traceback {} of {} ---' .format(i + 1, len(e.args)), file=sys.stderr) traceback.print_exception(*exc_info) raise

commit_message:
Stop deleting operation on busy volumes

Currently it's possible to trigger volume deletion on a
volume that is being operated on. This patch moves the
volume status checks to the beginning of the delete function
in order to prevent unwanted behavior that occurs by deleting
a volume that's busy.

Change-Id: I76422ecedc1d24e31d588c47fffb837191b2b828
Closes-bug: #1418715

commit_message:
authors/changelog updates for 2.8 release

Change-Id: I335c30fd7d0a0120c87fa60c5c142b8ed95c56bf
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-swiftclient refs/changes/74/281974/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 2.8.0 ----- * Python 2.6 support has been removed. * Object downloads that fail partway through will now retry with a Range request to read the rest of the object. * Object uploads will be retried if the source supports seek/tell. * Delete requests will use the cluster's bulk delete feature, if available, for requests that would require three or more individual deletes. * The delete CLI option now accepts a --prefix option to delete objects that start with the given prefix (similar to the same-named option for list). * Add support for the auth-version to be specified using --os-identity-api-version or OS_IDENTITY_API_VERSION for compatibility with other openstack client command line options. * --debug and --info command-line options now work anywhere in the command. * Objects can now be uploaded to pseudo-directories with the CLI. * Fixed an issue with uploading a large object that includes a unicode path. * swiftclient can now accept a tenent and token for auth against Keystone. * Various other minor bug fixes and improvements.

commit_message:
Force target_lun to be int type to make os-brick happy

The X-IO driver was returning the target_lun field as a string
from initialize_connection. It has to be an int to not cause
breakage later on.

Change-Id: I41c91b78753a2007c243ed30731f0a0cd92e68b5
Closes-Bug: #1549048

commit_message:
Fix error message in imagebackend

When use RBD as storage backend and try to resize instance
to smaller flavor, resize fails with wrong message.
This fix it.

Closes-Bug: #1544599
Change-Id: I62add102bbf3c7064583892dbcc91d4683afe96e

commit_message:
Use assertRaises() to check specific exception

In test_run_terminate_deallocate_net_failure_sets_error_state(),

        ......

        try:
            self.compute.terminate_instance(self.context, instance, [], [])
        except test.TestingException:
            pass

        ......

The block aims at ensuring that terminate_instance() raises TestingException.
But this is incorrect because if TestingException is not raised by
terminate_instance(), which means if the terminate_instance() finishes normally,
the block will pass too.

This patch fixes it by using assertRaises() to check the exception.

Change-Id: I06aba3fe1199e500565d1251b180ce6ca1d4aec1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/20/280120/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.assertRaises(test.TestingException, self.compute.terminate_instance, self.context, instance, [], [])

subject: Add check to limit maximum value of max_rows
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-10 09:28:54.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/test_nova_manage.py', 'nova/cmd/manage.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/02141ae7d7af5a9e04f0c64488dcfc8aeabf82f6', 'message': 'Add check to limit maximum value of max_rows

Currently archive_deleted_rows() fails if we provide
a very large number as input. This patch adds a check
to see that max_rows should not exceed db.MAX_INT and
provides a meaningful error message to the user.

Change-Id: I66a5d2cc7b7101e987ee89fcc7779bd9d5a4d144
Closes-Bug: #1543937
'}]
commit_message:
Add check to limit maximum value of max_rows

Currently archive_deleted_rows() fails if we provide
a very large number as input. This patch adds a check
to see that max_rows should not exceed db.MAX_INT and
provides a meaningful error message to the user.

Change-Id: I66a5d2cc7b7101e987ee89fcc7779bd9d5a4d144
Closes-Bug: #1543937
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/68/278268/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if max_rows > db.MAX_INT: print(_('max rows must be <= %(max_value)d') % {'max_value': db.MAX_INT}) return(1)

subject: neutron: remove redundant request.network_id assignment
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-11 22:42:10.000000000', 'files': ['nova/network/neutronv2/api.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/ef6c504ece481f9a070a9bf14bfbe40bf4d6ffbd', 'message': "neutron: remove redundant request.network_id assignment

Earlier in this loop we're checking the requested network IDs
against the available networks and when we find a match we
move on, if we don't find a match we skip that requested network.

For whatever reason, probably refactors over time, we were setting
the request.network_id to the network['id'] value but we set the
network variable from the net variable whose id matched the
request.network_id, so they are the same.

Anyway, remove this code since it's redundant and confusing.

Change-Id: I33755c81539238e68e0f559477fc137c68fdc6cb
"}]
commit_message:
neutron: remove redundant request.network_id assignment

Earlier in this loop we're checking the requested network IDs
against the available networks and when we find a match we
move on, if we don't find a match we skip that requested network.

For whatever reason, probably refactors over time, we were setting
the request.network_id to the network['id'] value but we set the
network variable from the net variable whose id matched the
request.network_id, so they are the same.

Anyway, remove this code since it's redundant and confusing.

Change-Id: I33755c81539238e68e0f559477fc137c68fdc6cb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/95/279295/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
enable ambari plugin by default

this change enables ambari plugin by default. It supports
all needed features (cluster creation and scaling). Sahara CI
is stable for this plugin.

Change-Id: Ic3c1736eb5c088eb22b51bae97a3a1f4eccaee2c

Adds support for the Neutron-LBaaSv2 Listener to Heat.

commit_message:
Updating HPE LeftHand minimum client version

The HPE LeftHand driver now has a minimum python-lefthandclient
version of 2.1.0.

This patch updates the version numbers accordingly.

Closes-Bug: 1550529
Change-Id: I3c2c857f13317052aa96d0d3755375ed9ce3f45c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/81/285581/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: * Install the ``python-lefthandclient`` version 2.0.0 from the Python Package $ pip install 'python-lefthandclient>=2.0'

commit_message:
make voting puppet/scenario003 on centos7

scenario003 is now ready to vote on centos7 nodes.

This patch:
* enable voting for scenario003 in general (but a later rule disable
  voting for ubuntu systems, that are unstable now).
* run the jobs only after stable/liberty (current master and beyond).

Change-Id: Ic296ae126d6cd299f127e9358b1c22e63a6bc5c6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/55/284855/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # scenario003 was added during Mitaka cycle branch: ^(?!stable/(kilo|liberty)).*$
deleted_lines: # First implementation of scenario003 integration job should be non-voting # and only on the master branch (now). branch: master voting: false

commit_message:
Add build_requests database table and model

The build_requests table is a placeholder in the api database that
stores enough information about a boot request to hydrate an Instance if
necessary.  It will be populated early in the boot process so that instance
creation can be deferred until after scheduling.

Partially-implements: bp cells-scheduling-interaction
Change-Id: I8755e57c0ea9afd1c83751dea75cca640e304ab0

added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from sqlalchemy import Column from sqlalchemy import DateTime from sqlalchemy import Index from sqlalchemy import Integer from sqlalchemy import MetaData from sqlalchemy import String from sqlalchemy import Table from sqlalchemy import Text from nova.db.sqlalchemy import types def upgrade(migrate_engine): meta = MetaData() meta.bind = migrate_engine build_requests = Table('build_requests', meta, Column('created_at', DateTime), Column('updated_at', DateTime), Column('id', Integer, primary_key=True, nullable=False), Column('instance_uuid', String(36), nullable=False), Column('project_id', String(length=255), nullable=False), Column('user_id', String(length=255), nullable=False), Column('image', String(length=255), nullable=True), Column('access_ip_v4', types.IPAddress(), nullable=True), Column('access_ip_v6', types.IPAddress(), nullable=True), Column('progress', Integer), Column('vm_state', String(length=255)), Column('task_state', String(length=255)), Column('metadata', Text, nullable=True), Column('request_spec', Text, nullable=False), Column('flavor', Text, nullable=False), Index('build_request_instance_uuid_idx', 'instance_uuid'), Index('build_request_project_id_idx', 'project_id'), mysql_engine='InnoDB', mysql_charset='utf8' ) build_requests.create(checkfirst=True)

commit_message:
Updating sample configuration file

Change-Id: Id5dce04c754af85c9ba0fc6bcf363e2fb0c93a47
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/04/284804/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # in that only one should be provided. If both are provided then the existence # of this option overrides the usage of that option. (string value)#max_overflow = 50
deleted_lines: # Enables or disables syslog rfc5424 format for logging. If enabled, prefixes # the MSG part of the syslog message with APP-NAME (RFC5424). This option is # ignored if log_config_append is set. (boolean value) # This option is deprecated for removal. # Its value may be silently ignored in the future. # Reason: The format without the APP-NAME is deprecated in Kilo, and will be # removed in Mitaka, along with this option. #use_syslog_rfc_format = true # in that only one should be be provided. If both are provided then the # existence of this option overrides the usage of that option. (string value)#max_overflow = <None>

subject: Share Replication API and Scheduler Support
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-22 15:27:55.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/manila/commit/dac7938116cfdbee468b3fbdfe42a3ab397fd347', 'message': "[WIP] Share Replication API and Scheduler Support

This patch provides the scheduler support to filter share
backends matching replication capabilities reported by the
hosts and the replication extra_spec provided via the
share_type during share creation.

It also adds wsgi routes, API endpoints and driver entry
routines to support the actions: list, show, create, delete
and promote share replicas. It augments the ShareInstance
DB model with a 'replica_state' attribute and the Share DB
Model with 'replication' attribute to support these
workflows.

Replica states are periodically updated from the respective
backends that they are created on.

This patch also re-factors the 'authorize' method in the
'Controller' class within api/openstack/wsgi as a decorator
to reuse in share_replicas and future APIs.

Implements: blueprint manila-share-replication

Change-Id: I10515d55b1291c34777a31d8c6a3a1954f551235

"}, {'number': 11, 'created': '2015-12-07 16:58:22.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/manila/commit/fcfd0bba2d6ce98d1fa5b3bcef3a20a8feb1db1c', 'message': "Share Replication API and Scheduler Support

This patch provides the scheduler support to filter share
backends matching replication capabilities reported by the
hosts and the replication_type extra_spec provided via the
share_type during share creation.

It also adds wsgi routes, API endpoints and driver entry
routines to support the actions: list, show, create, delete
and promote share replicas. It augments the ShareInstance
DB model with a 'replica_state' attribute and the Share DB
Model with 'replication_type' attribute to support these
workflows.

Replica states are periodically updated from the respective
backends that the replicas are created on.

APIImpact
Impact on existing APIs:
In Microversion 2.8, the shares API returns an additional
field during index and show calls for each share: 'has_replicas'
indicating whether the share is currently replicated. Also,
deletion of a share that has replicas is forbidden returning error
code 403.

Implements: blueprint manila-share-replication

Change-Id: I10515d55b1291c34777a31d8c6a3a1954f551235

indicating whether the share is currently replicated. Also,

Implements: blueprint manila-share-replication

Change-Id: I10515d55b1291c34777a31d8c6a3a1954f551235

"}, {'number': 16, 'created': '2016-01-25 02:07:54.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/manila/commit/4fdb2bc28bc70f1a095d9119ff43a019e1d812cd', 'message': "Share Replication API and Scheduler Support

This patch provides the scheduler support to filter share
backends matching replication capabilities reported by the
hosts and the replication_type extra_spec provided via the
share_type during share creation.

It also adds wsgi routes, API endpoints and driver entry
routines to support the actions: list, show, create, delete
and promote share replicas. It augments the ShareInstance
DB model with a 'replica_state' attribute and the Share DB
Model with 'replication_type' attribute to support these
workflows.

Replica states are periodically updated from the respective
backends that the replicas are created on.

APIImpact
Impact on existing APIs:
In Microversion 2.10, the /shares APIs return 2 additional
fields during index and show calls for each share: 'has_replicas'
and 'replication_type'. Similarly, the field 'replica_state' is
added to the API response for /share-instances.
Also, deletion of a share that has replicas is forbidden,
returning error code 403.

Implements: blueprint manila-share-replication

Change-Id: I10515d55b1291c34777a31d8c6a3a1954f551235

APIImpact
Impact on existing APIs:
In Microversion 2.11, the /shares APIs return 2 additional
fields during index and show calls for each share: 'has_replicas'
and 'replication_type'. Similarly, the field 'replica_state' is
added to the API response for /share-instances.
Also, deletion of a share that has replicas is forbidden,
returning error code 403.

Implements: blueprint manila-share-replication

commit_message:
Share Replication API and Scheduler Support

This patch provides the scheduler support to filter share
backends matching replication capabilities reported by the
hosts and the replication_type extra_spec provided via the
share_type during share creation.

It also adds wsgi routes, API endpoints and driver entry
routines to support the actions: list, show, create, delete
and promote share replicas. It augments the ShareInstance
DB model with a 'replica_state' attribute and the Share DB
Model with 'replication_type' attribute to support these
workflows.

Replica states are periodically updated from the respective
backends that the replicas are created on.

APIImpact
Impact on existing APIs:
In Microversion 2.11, the /shares APIs return 2 additional
fields during index and show calls for each share: 'has_replicas'
and 'replication_type'. Similarly, the field 'replica_state' is
added to the API response for /share-instances.
Also, deletion of a share that has replicas is forbidden,
returning error code 403.

DocImpact

Co-Authored-By: Alex Meade <mr.alex.meade@gmail.com>

Implements: blueprint manila-share-replication

Change-Id: I10515d55b1291c34777a31d8c6a3a1954f551235

commit_message:
[identity][v3/credentials] Type of "blob" parameter must be "xsd:string"

Change type of "blob" parameter from "xsd:dict" to "xsd:string".

Change-Id: I22c560307319babc04d1e31fe6eb13eefb71652b

subject: Implement DBaaS Ceilometer Notifications
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-25 14:25:20.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/trove/commit/d9f0b6246de93f499943c5ba1c64d91f22a1214f', 'message': 'Implement DBaaS Ceilometer Notifications

Defines and implements create|end|error notifications for
all state-changing Trove API calls.  Adds a notification to
the TroveContext to transfer the notification to the guest
and conductor so that errors on asynchronous commands can
be forwarded to the Conductor to be transferred to the
control plane bus.

Also did some cleanup on the existing notifications to bring
them all under a common framework in trove/common/notifications.py.
The trove.instance.exists notification was not integrated into
the new framework due to its close-coupling with the Nova
notification code.

Implements Blueprint: ceilometer-integration

Change-Id: I9c57d24f80d8d3116fc0cc8948094087a0495135
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-12-07 16:24:18.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/trove/commit/81316c943d46dd4d14cb0d9cd4376ea471f5c982', 'message': 'Implement DBaaS Ceilometer Notifications

Defines and implements create|end|error notifications for
all state-changing Trove API calls.  Adds a notification to
the TroveContext to transfer the notification to the guest
and conductor so that errors on asynchronous commands can
be forwarded to the Conductor to be transferred to the
control plane bus.

Also did some cleanup on the existing notifications to bring
them all under a common framework in trove/common/notifications.py.
The trove.instance.exists notification was not integrated into
the new framework due to its close-coupling with the Nova
notification code.

Implements Blueprint: ceilometer-integration

Change-Id: I9c57d24f80d8d3116fc0cc8948094087a0495135

Defines and implements create|end|error notifications for
all state-changing Trove API calls.  Adds a notification to
the TroveContext to transfer the notification to the guest
and conductor so that errors on asynchronous commands can
be forwarded to the Conductor to be transferred to the
control plane bus.

Also did some cleanup on the existing notifications to bring
them all under a common framework in trove/common/notifications.py.
The trove.instance.exists notification was not integrated into
the new framework due to its close-coupling with the Nova
notification code.

Implements Blueprint: ceilometer-integration

Change-Id: I9c57d24f80d8d3116fc0cc8948094087a0495135

commit_message:
Implement DBaaS Ceilometer Notifications

Defines and implements create|end|error notifications for
all state-changing Trove API calls.  Adds a notification to
the TroveContext to transfer the notification to the guest
and conductor so that errors on asynchronous commands can
be forwarded to the Conductor to be transferred to the
control plane bus.

Also did some cleanup on the existing notifications to bring
them all under a common framework in trove/common/notifications.py.
The trove.instance.exists notification was not integrated into
the new framework due to its close-coupling with the Nova
notification code.

Reworked the cluster action mechanism to move routing
functionality from the strategy to the Cluster base
class.  This was done to support tying notifications
to cluster specific actions.

Implements Blueprint: ceilometer-integration

Change-Id: I9c57d24f80d8d3116fc0cc8948094087a0495135
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/trove refs/changes/70/227870/12 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

'}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2016-02-17 15:03:39.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/0d1bee288d895fcf5421e75b76dd43f8a8657d3b', 'message': "WIP: Abort an ongoing live migration

This change adds a DELETE call on the server-migrations object to cancel
a running live migration of a specific instance.
TO perform the cancellation the virtualization driver needs to support
it, in case that the feature is not supported we return an error.
We allow a cancellation of a migration only if the migration is
running at the moment of the request and if the migration type is equal
to 'live-migration'.
In this change we implement this feature for the libvirt driver.
When the cancellation of a live migration succeeded we rollback the live
migration and we set the state of the Migration object equals to
'cancelled'.
The implementation of this change is based on the work done by the
implementation of the feature called 'force live migration':
https://review.openstack.org/245921

DocImpact
ApiImpact

Implements blueprint: abort-live-migration
Change-Id: I1ff861e54997a069894b542bd764ac3ef1b3dbb2

commit_message:
Abort an ongoing live migration

This change adds a DELETE call on the server-migrations object to cancel
a running live migration of a specific instance.
TO perform the cancellation the virtualization driver needs to support
it, in case that the feature is not supported we return an error.
We allow a cancellation of a migration only if the migration is
running at the moment of the request and if the migration type is equal
to 'live-migration'.
In this change we implement this feature for the libvirt driver.
When the cancellation of a live migration succeeded we rollback the live
migration and we set the state of the Migration object equals to
'cancelled'.
The implementation of this change is based on the work done by the
implementation of the feature called 'force live migration':
https://review.openstack.org/245921

DocImpact
ApiImpact

Implements blueprint: abort-live-migration
Change-Id: I1ff861e54997a069894b542bd764ac3ef1b3dbb2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/71/277971/16 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @check_instance_state(task_state=[task_states.MIGRATING]) def live_migrate_abort(self, context, instance, migration_id): """Abort an in-progress live migration. :param context: Security context :param instance: The instance that is being migrated :param migration_id: ID of in-progress live migration """ LOG.debug("Going to abort live migration", instance=instance) migration = objects.Migration.get_by_id_and_instance(context, migration_id, instance.uuid) if migration.migration_type != 'live-migration': raise exception.InvalidMigrationType(migration_id=migration_id, instance_uuid=instance.uuid, migration_type=migration.migration_type, method='abort live migration') if migration.status != 'running': raise exception.InvalidMigrationState(migration_id=migration_id, instance_uuid=instance.uuid, state=migration.status, method='abort live migration') self.compute_rpcapi.live_migration_abort(context, instance, migration.id)

subject: NetApp: E-Series remove snapshot limitations
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-10 16:55:29.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/eb4f9734defeaf60aefa39316c151b63222ca193', 'message': 'NetApp: E-Series remove snapshot limitations

The E-Series backend does not allow snapshots defined under a snapshot
group to be deleted out of order. Only the oldest snapshot image may
be deleted. In order to work around this behavior, we would only define
a single snapshot on each snapshot group. Unfortunately, this would
limit the total number of snapshots to a total of 4 per volume.

In order to remove this limitation without causing deletion errors
when a newer snapshot is deleted, a soft-delete was implemented that
will remove the snapshot from Cinder management and purge the
snapshot from the backend once other dependent snapshots have been
deleted.

In order to ensure that our clone operations have a snapshot group
available, one of the 4 snapshot groups that can be defined on a
volume will be reserved for clone operations and will not be
allowed to be utlized for snapshot creation. This will limit the
total number of snapshots supported per volume to a maximum of 96.

The new 1.4 version of the Webservices proxy is required in order
to support the full snapshot behavior. Since snapshots are such
an integral part of the driver, 1.4 is now required for running
the driver with this release.

Co-Authored-By: Erik Johannes <erik.johannes@netapp.com>
Change-Id: Ie097743b167c1086ecf0536ad696786bdcd241b2

commit_message:
NetApp: E-Series remove snapshot limitations

The E-Series backend does not allow snapshots defined under a snapshot
group to be deleted out of order. Only the oldest snapshot image may
be deleted. In order to work around this behavior, we would only define
a single snapshot on each snapshot group. Unfortunately, this would
limit the total number of snapshots to a total of 4 per volume.

In order to remove this limitation without causing deletion errors
when a newer snapshot is deleted, a soft-delete was implemented that
will remove the snapshot from Cinder management and purge the
snapshot from the backend once other dependent snapshots have been
deleted.

In order to ensure that our clone operations have a snapshot group
available, one of the 4 snapshot groups that can be defined on a
volume will be reserved for clone operations and will not be
allowed to be utilized for snapshot creation. This will limit the
total number of snapshots supported per volume to a maximum of 96.

The new 1.4 version of the WebServices proxy is required in order
to support the full snapshot behavior. Since snapshots are such
an integral part of the driver, 1.4 is now required for running
the driver with this release.

Co-Authored-By: Erik Johannes <erik.johannes@netapp.com>
Change-Id: Ie097743b167c1086ecf0536ad696786bdcd241b2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/15/278515/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright (c) 2016 Michael Price. All rights reserved. @ddt.ddt class BitSetTestCase(test.TestCase): def setUp(self): super(BitSetTestCase, self).setUp() def test_default(self): self.assertEqual(na_utils.BitSet(0), na_utils.BitSet()) def test_set(self): bitset = na_utils.BitSet(0) bitset.set(16) self.assertEqual(na_utils.BitSet(1 << 16), bitset) def test_unset(self): bitset = na_utils.BitSet(1 << 16) bitset.unset(16) self.assertEqual(na_utils.BitSet(0), bitset) def test_is_set(self): bitset = na_utils.BitSet(1 << 16) self.assertTrue(bitset.is_set(16)) def test_not_equal(self): set1 = na_utils.BitSet(1 << 15) set2 = na_utils.BitSet(1 << 16) self.assertNotEqual(set1, set2) def test_repr(self): raw_val = 1 << 16 actual = repr(na_utils.BitSet(raw_val)) expected = str(raw_val) self.assertEqual(actual, expected) def test_str(self): raw_val = 1 << 16 actual = str(na_utils.BitSet(raw_val)) expected = bin(raw_val) self.assertEqual(actual, expected) def test_int(self): val = 1 << 16 actual = int(int(na_utils.BitSet(val))) self.assertEqual(val, actual) def test_and(self): actual = na_utils.BitSet(1 << 16 | 1 << 15) actual &= 1 << 16 self.assertEqual(na_utils.BitSet(1 << 16), actual) def test_or(self): actual = na_utils.BitSet() actual |= 1 << 16 self.assertEqual(na_utils.BitSet(1 << 16), actual) def test_invert(self): actual = na_utils.BitSet(1 << 16) actual = ~actual self.assertEqual(~(1 << 16), actual) def test_xor(self): actual = na_utils.BitSet(1 << 16) actual ^= 1 << 16 self.assertEqual(na_utils.BitSet(), actual) def test_lshift(self): actual = na_utils.BitSet(1) actual <<= 16 self.assertEqual(na_utils.BitSet(1 << 16), actual) def test_rshift(self): actual = na_utils.BitSet(1 << 16) actual >>= 16 self.assertEqual(na_utils.BitSet(1), actual)

subject: Fix two bugs in online_data_migrations()
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-23 16:43:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/a0611e84d02509d4021b23cc45505c204caf4621', 'message': 'Fix two bugs in online_data_migrations()

This fixes two issues with the print statement in online_data_migrations(),
one which prevents any useful information from being displayed, and one
that actually causes us to fail in an error handling path.

The first is that print does not take a second argument of a dict for the
string formatting (like log does, which is what was probably intended here).
Thus, we dump out the raw formatted string and the dict to stdout.

The second is a formatted string in the error path for migration methods,
which wants a dict mapping but is passed a string. When that happens,
we explode.

I found these in the process of the previous patch, so decided to fix them
after making that change, but these were present in the original code.

Change-Id: I2bd0ddd1ee828a584cb062a9a6a846f5d36cb750
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-02-23 17:10:25.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/e86b34bbb46c785d345d09fea972a6a4727abc21', 'message': 'Fix two bugs in online_data_migrations()

The second is a formatted string in the error path for migration methods,

commit_message:
Fix two bugs in online_data_migrations()

This fixes two issues with the print statement in online_data_migrations(),
one which prevents any useful information from being displayed, and one
that actually causes us to fail in an error handling path.

The first is that print does not take a second argument of a dict for the
string formatting (like log does, which is what was probably intended here).
Thus, we dump out the raw formatted string and the dict to stdout.

The second is a formatted string in the error path for migration methods,
which wants a dict mapping but is passed a string. When that happens,
we explode.

I found these in the process of the previous patch, so decided to fix them
after making that change, but these were present in the original code.

Change-Id: I2bd0ddd1ee828a584cb062a9a6a846f5d36cb750

commit_message:
StackResource/RemoteStack replacement

Change _needs_update method of StackResource and RemoteStack to raise
UpdateReplace exception when state is CHECK_FAILED. This will cause
Heat to replace the failed resources.

Change-Id: I496e589318c554a980d1d6aa9a4a8f5ec74d2c6d
Partially-implements: blueprint mark-unhealthy
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/42/270042/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # If resource is in CHECK_FAILED state, raise UpdateReplace # to replace the failed stack. if self.state == (self.CHECK, self.FAILED): raise exception.UpdateReplace(self)

commit_message:
EMC VMAX - not cleaning up HW Resource WWPN initiators

On cleanup, the last volume is unmapped and the masking view and
storage group are deleted. Now the initiator group and the associated
StorageHardwareIDs are also deleted as long as that initiator group
is no longer contained in another masking view.

Change-Id: Ib159f719a9c5cbac5c6ea0b7d9474a64a0335b71
Closes-Bug: #1504192

commit_message:
Look for volumev2 endpoints instead of volume

Volumes tabs should be enabled when volumev2 endpoint is registered.
Currently, Horizon considers no volume service is running if there
is no V1 endpoint, which doesn't make sense as Horizon no longer
supports the cinder V1 protocol.

Co-Authored-By: itxaka <itxaka@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I35d821eedb75f73f9330ed11f921694104eed0c6
Closes-Bug: 1415712

commit_message:
Fix tests view columns size

This commit fixes tests view columns size to be better viewing.
Originally, 'style="min-width:"' is specified, but it seems harmful for
the layout. So this commit just removes them.

Closes-Bug: #1544859
Change-Id: Ifbb73f92499b4a0174b1dab2b8745341dbfb228f

2. Add ref link for /os-migrations
The old top-level resource `/os-migrations` won't be extended anymore.
It is deprecated.
Adding ref link to the /servers/{uuid}/migrations/{id} for it.

Partially implements blueprint live-migration-progress-report

commit_message:
Add new APIs and deprecate old API for migrations

This patch does two things:
1. Add two APIs /servers/migrations:index/show for server migrations.
Two new novaclient commands server-migration-list and
server-migration-show will also be added.
ref: I071198fa9ba0699383bdebf4fab54714a435e6c3

2. Add ref link for /os-migrations
The old top-level resource `/os-migrations` won't be extended anymore.
It is deprecated.
Adding migration_type for it, also add ref link to
/servers/{uuid}/migrations/{id} for it when the migration is an
in progress migration.

Partially implements blueprint live-migration-progress-report

Change-Id: Ia92ecbe3c99082e3a34adf4fd29041b1a95ef21e
Co-authored-by: ShaoHe Feng <shaohe.feng@intel.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/71/258771/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def migrations_get_in_progress_by_instance(context, instance_uuid, status): result = model_query(context, models.Migration, read_deleted="yes").\ filter_by(instance_uuid=instance_uuid).\ filter(~models.Migration.status.in_(['accepted', 'confirmed', 'reverted', 'error'])) if not result: raise exception.MigrationNotFoundByStatus(instance_uuid=instance_uuid, status=status) return result

commit_message:
Revert "Fix bug at update quota of project's network item"

This reverts commit 02fb01b4b7b23fb7d32520e9293cfce3dc8d8b3f.

This change broke the project panel in a severe way.  Please see bug 1550505.

Change-Id: Id5dd71efff914a9c84ac7b35ac0359f7747155ad
Closes-bug: #1550505

deleted_lines: # NOTE(ZhengYue): Mapping for differents between keys from neutron usage # and tenant_quota_usages NEUTRON_USAGE_FIELDS_MAP = { 'network': 'networks', 'subnet': 'subnets', 'port': 'ports', 'router': 'routers', 'floatingip': 'floating_ips', 'security_group': 'security_groups', 'security_group_rule': 'security_group_rules' } # NOTE(ZhengYue): Because the keys of network quota not match # with fields from tenant_quota_usages, do some amend at here. item_key = key if key in NEUTRON_USAGE_FIELDS_MAP: item_key = NEUTRON_USAGE_FIELDS_MAP[key] used = usages[item_key].get('used', 0)

commit_message:
Remove lib/cinder_backends/solidfire

This was something we used a while back, but since support
for sections was added to devstack local.conf parsing we
don't need this, and actually prefer just using the
sections in local.conf.

Here's an example of how to achieve the same thing via
local.conf sections:

CINDER_ENABLED_BACKENDS=solidfire
TEMPEST_VOLUME_DRIVER=SolidFireDriver
TEMPEST_VOLUME_VENDOR="SolidFire Inc"
TEMPEST_STORAGE_PROTOCOL=iSCSI

[[post-config|$CINDER_CONF]]
[DEFAULT]
CINDER_ENABLED_BACKENDS=solidfire
[solidfire]
volume_driver=cinder.volume.drivers.solidfire.SolidFireDriver
san_ip=192.168.160.3
san_login=admin
san_password=admin
volume_backend_name=solidfire

Change-Id: I8068fd4fb14510b15c31edf490283454f167f6c6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/02/273202/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: #!/bin/bash # # lib/cinder_backends/solidfire # Configure the solidfire driver # Enable with: # # CINDER_ENABLED_BACKENDS+=,solidfire:<volume-type-name> # Dependencies: # # - ``functions`` file # - ``cinder`` configurations # CINDER_CONF # configure_cinder_driver - make configuration changes, including those to other services # Save trace setting _XTRACE_CINDER_SOLIDFIRE=$(set +o | grep xtrace) set +o xtrace # Entry Points # ------------ # configure_cinder_backend_solidfire - Set config files, create data dirs, etc function configure_cinder_backend_solidfire { # To use SolidFire, set the following in local.conf: # CINDER_ENABLED_BACKENDS+=,solidfire:<volume-type-name> # SAN_IP=<mvip> # SAN_LOGIN=<cluster-admin-account> # SAN_PASSWORD=<cluster-admin-password> local be_name=$1 iniset $CINDER_CONF $be_name volume_backend_name $be_name iniset $CINDER_CONF $be_name volume_driver "cinder.volume.drivers.solidfire.SolidFireDriver" iniset $CINDER_CONF $be_name san_ip $SAN_IP iniset $CINDER_CONF $be_name san_login $SAN_LOGIN iniset $CINDER_CONF $be_name san_password $SAN_PASSWORD } # Restore xtrace $_XTRACE_CINDER_SOLIDFIRE # Local variables: # mode: shell-script # End:

commit_message:
Fix all properties errors for custom guidelines

There are several errors, raised during properties schemas
checking by custom guidelines. Need to fix them for successful
pep8 running.

implements bp custom-guidelines

Change-Id: Icd24498b8d36106412a61d4b82b00eb92095ffe9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/16/281816/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: _('Properties for profile.'),

subject: Support binary messages over websocket
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-12 21:31:54.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/zaqar/commit/26a4cd19ffd700831682ed257b5aad7df1b9f6b5', 'message': 'WIP. Support binary messages over websocket

For now Zaqar's websocket transport can only send and receive text
messages in JSON format.
By using messages in binary format it's possible to reduce network
traffic between Zaqar server and it's clients. In most cases it's also
possible to increase performance.

This patch implements support for binary messages over websocket
transport in Zaqar server.
The MessagePack format was chosen for encoding/decoding messages as it's
effective enough and available in convenient libraries for most
programming languages.

This patch also modifies "examples/websockets.html" example to be able
to send and receive binary messages. File "websockets.html" was also
splitted into three file parts: html, config and script. This makes code
inspection easier for the person who is interested. For example, when
script part resides in dedicated file syntax highlighting can be
applied.

WIP:
1. Spec is still uncofirmed and details are discussed, but it will
easy to tune this patch after final decision regarding details.
2. Zaqar still encodes subscription messages in JSON only.
3. Thread safety of "respond_in_binary" boolean variable is under
question.

blueprint: websocket-binary-support
Change-Id: I07a7c46795e3b510ee397a6d2c4665e770c2c4b2
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-12-12 21:33:11.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/zaqar/commit/bbcffe01888a3c46970a5cd0760fd4b7a963308f', 'message': 'WIP. Support binary messages over websocket

For now Zaqar's websocket transport can only send and receive text
messages in JSON format.
By using messages in binary format it's possible to reduce network
traffic between Zaqar server and it's clients. In most cases it's also
possible to increase performance.

This patch implements support for binary messages over websocket
transport in Zaqar server.
The MessagePack format was chosen for encoding/decoding messages as it's
effective enough and available in convenient libraries for most
programming languages.

This patch also modifies "examples/websockets.html" example to be able
to send and receive binary messages. File "websockets.html" was also
splitted into three file parts: html, config and script. This makes code
inspection easier for the person who is interested. For example, when
script part resides in dedicated file, syntax highlighting can be
applied.

WIP:
1. Spec is still uncofirmed and details are discussed, but it will
easy to tune this patch after final decision regarding details.
2. Zaqar still encodes subscription messages in JSON only.
3. Thread safety of "respond_in_binary" boolean variable is under
question.

blueprint: websocket-binary-support
Change-Id: I07a7c46795e3b510ee397a6d2c4665e770c2c4b2
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2015-12-12 21:33:56.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/zaqar/commit/330658be3a01a0117b96e89816edcb44f872eba9', 'message': 'WIP. Support binary messages over websocket

This patch also modifies "examples/websockets.html" example to be able
to send and receive binary messages. File "websockets.html" was also
splitted into three file parts: html, config and script. This makes code
inspection easier for the person who is interested. For example, when
script part resides in dedicated file, syntax highlighting can be
applied.

WIP:
1. Spec is still uncofirmed and details are discussed, but it will be
easy to tune this patch after final decision regarding details.
2. Zaqar still encodes subscription messages in JSON only.
3. Thread safety of "respond_in_binary" boolean variable is under
question.

blueprint: websocket-binary-support
Change-Id: I07a7c46795e3b510ee397a6d2c4665e770c2c4b2

commit_message:
Support binary messages over websocket

For now Zaqar's websocket transport can only send and receive text
messages in JSON format.
By using messages in binary format it's possible to reduce network
traffic between Zaqar server and it's clients. In most cases it's also
possible to increase performance.

This patch implements support for binary messages over websocket
transport in Zaqar server.
The MessagePack format was chosen for encoding/decoding messages as it's
effective enough and available in convenient libraries for most
programming languages.

This patch also modifies "examples/websockets.html" example to be able
to send and receive binary messages.

All "print" function calls are substituted to local logger calls.

DocImpact
APIImpact The patch adds new functionality. Now sending binary request
over websocket doesn't automatically return response with code 400,
because now websocket transport is able to process binary requests
encoded in MessagePack.
blueprint: websocket-binary-support
Change-Id: I07a7c46795e3b510ee397a6d2c4665e770c2c4b2

close services in test

our gate is hanging because oslo.messaging will persist if we don't
kill notification service at end of test.

Fix summary line for setup.cfg

Project summary should indicate the type of service instead
of just the project name

This patch works around the fact that network isolation is
broken when setting the SoftwareConfigTransport == POLL_TEMP_URL

commit_message:
Set Heat transport to CFN when using netiso

This patch works around the fact that network isolation is
broken when setting the SoftwareConfigTransport == POLL_TEMP_URL
(currently our default). Switching back to POLL_SERVER_CFN
seems to work around the issue.

Change-Id: I317a96e98c3181ccb8fd08ea353616fba55ae3e2
Related-bug: #1550380
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/46/285346/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: parameter_defaults: # network isolation broken when SoftwareConfigTransport == POLL_TEMP_URL # https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1550380 SoftwareConfigTransport: POLL_SERVER_CFN

commit_message:
Callbacks: add precommit support

Commit c24e9da2f82676d9b9d8c28018bf49c8a294121b added this support.
This ports that code to the lib.

Change-Id: I2578224f5a3bef46dfedb267fb5b944bec0b296d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lib refs/changes/05/280505/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: PRECOMMIT_CREATE = 'precommit_create' PRECOMMIT_UPDATE = 'precommit_update' PRECOMMIT_DELETE = 'precommit_delete' PRECOMMIT = 'precommit_'

commit_message:
Fix py34 error of indexing 'dict_keys' object

In python3, keys() of a dict isn't a list and cannot be indexed.

Change-Id: Iddced3a8856f4c66235779a7dde65d2604fae244
Closes-Bug: #1550184

subject: Force header keys/values to bytes/unicode before coercing to unicode
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-26 19:36:57.000000000', 'files': ['tests/unit/test_swiftclient.py', 'swiftclient/client.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-swiftclient/commit/aa0edd00966237163451fc44cda2c593a5215cbe', 'message': "Force header keys/values to bytes/unicode before coercing to unicode

Previously, parse_header_string was only called with data coming out of
requests, which would be either bytes or unicode. Now that we're sending
it request headers as well (see related change), we need to be more
defensive.

If the value given is neither bytes nor unicode, convert it to a native
string. This will allow developers using the client API to continue
sending header dicts like

  {'X-Delete-After': 2}

...as in Swift's test/probe/test_object_expirer.py

Change-Id: Ie57a93274507b184af5cad4260f244359a585f09
Related-Change: I43dd7254f7281d4db59b286aa2145643c64e1705
"}]
commit_message:
Force header keys/values to bytes/unicode before coercing to unicode

Previously, parse_header_string was only called with data coming out of
requests, which would be either bytes or unicode. Now that we're sending
it request headers as well (see related change), we need to be more
defensive.

If the value given is neither bytes nor unicode, convert it to a native
string. This will allow developers using the client API to continue
sending header dicts like

  {'X-Delete-After': 2}

...as in Swift's test/probe/test_object_expirer.py

Change-Id: Ie57a93274507b184af5cad4260f244359a585f09
Related-Change: I43dd7254f7281d4db59b286aa2145643c64e1705

commit_message:
Use http protocol by default in auth_address for Swift backend

This commit explicitly sets default protocol to http in
swift_store_auth_address variable for Swift backend, because without
any specified protocol it will use https by default. That's not
consistent with other default values for protocols in auth addresses.

Change-Id: I232536d179db92d82f1c7459a0f13e5ca5576f42

commit_message:
Fix doc build warnings

The documentation build was printing warnigs like

 doc/source/auth-totp.rst:111: SEVERE: Title level inconsistent:

 Tokens
 ======

This is because subtitle is being used incorrectly, see[1]. The
subtitles are changed to section headers instead.

[1] http://docutils.sourceforge.net/docs/user/rst/quickstart.html#document-title-subtitle

Also corrected these warnings:

 keystone/tests/unit/test_v3_assignment.py:docstring of
  keystone.tests.unit.test_v3_assignment.ImpliedRolesTests.
  test_list_role_assignments_with_implied_roles:9: ERROR: Unexpected
  indentation.
 keystone/keystone/tests/unit/test_v3_assignment.py:docstring of
  keystone.tests.unit.test_v3_assignment.ImpliedRolesTests.
  test_list_role_assignments_with_implied_roles:10: WARNING: Block
  quote ends without a blank line; unexpected unindent.

Change-Id: Ib88dbc7a31a6aed8048966574ac998b5332862c7

commit_message:
Add support for DeployArtifactURLs

Adds a new nested stack deployment which allows operators to
opt-in to deploy tarball's and RPM packages by setting
DeployArtifactURLs as a parameter_default in a Heat
environment.

The intent is to use this setting to allow t-h-t to
transparently deploy things like tarballs of puppet modules
via a Swift Temp URL.

Change-Id: I1bad4a4a79cf297f5b6e439e0657269738b5f326
Implements: blueprint puppet-modules-deployment-via-swift

commit_message:
Fix Directory Check in Agent

Remove name, pattern and recursive in directory check to make
directory check only checks for the size of the target directory
(not file size)

Add directory detection plugin to automatically generate
directory.yaml file

Change-Id: I10fde0a4ed43f62c310045bccccb3a66e07542e1

added_lines: from monasca_setup.detection.utils import watch_directory self.directory_names = kwargs.get('directory_names') self.search_pattern = kwargs.get('search_pattern') if 'directory_names' in args_dict: self.directory_names = args_dict['directory_names'] if self.directory_names: self.available = True if self.directory_names: for dir_name in self.directory_names: # default to be recursive log.info("\tMonitoring the size of directory {0}.".format( dir_name)) config.merge(watch_directory(dir_name))

commit_message:
Removal of unnecessary `import_opt`s for cells config options

After centralizing cells options, importing nova.conf module is
enough for using cells options. import_opt(<opt_name>, <module>)
functions are not necessary.

Blueprint centralize-config-options

Change-Id: I9aabe8f2cc337c1237c2a73475cc1a3d3f4a1575

commit_message:
Making root_url configurable

  This commit will make universal modifications to the way the "root_url"
  parameter is set so that a person can modify it.  Adjusts tests
  accordingly and improves on beaker success scenario.

  This needs to occur to allow people the ability to serve horizon from the
  root of a vhost.

Change-Id: If43ea694b2601c55a4b07c1cd5fc411abbaaaa2d
