See the +# License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations +# under the License. + +import uuid + +from oslo_config import cfg + +from keystone import exception +from keystone.identity import controllers +from keystone.tests import unit +from keystone.tests.unit.ksfixtures import database + + +CONF = cfg.CONF + +_ADMIN_CONTEXT = {'is_admin': True, 'query_string': {}} + + +class UserTestCaseNoDefaultDomain(unit.TestCase): + + def setUp(self): + super(UserTestCaseNoDefaultDomain, self).setUp() + self.useFixture(database.Database()) + self.load_backends() + self.user_controller = controllers.User() + + def test_setup(self): + # Other tests in this class assume there's no default domain, so make + # sure the setUp worked as expected. + self.assertRaises( + exception.DomainNotFound, + self.resource_api.get_domain, CONF.identity.default_domain_id) + + def test_get_users(self): + # When list_users is done and there's no default domain, the result is + # an empty list. + res = self.user_controller.get_users(_ADMIN_CONTEXT) + self.assertEqual([], res['users']) + + def test_get_user_by_name(self): + # When get_user_by_name is done and there's no default domain, the + # result is 404 Not Found + user_name = uuid.uuid4().hex + self.assertRaises( + exception.UserNotFound, + self.user_controller.get_user_by_name, _ADMIN_CONTEXT, user_name) + + def test_create_user(self): + # When a user is created using the v2 controller and there's no default + # domain, it doesn't fail with can't find domain (a default domain is + # created) + user = {'name': uuid.uuid4().hex} + self.user_controller.create_user(_ADMIN_CONTEXT, user) + # If the above doesn't fail then this is successful. diff --git a/keystone/tests/unit/resource/__init__.py b/keystone/tests/unit/resource/__init__.py new file mode 100644 index 0000000..e69de29 --- /dev/null +++ b/keystone/tests/unit/resource/__init__.py diff --git a/keystone/tests/unit/resource/test_controllers.py b/keystone/tests/unit/resource/test_controllers.py new file mode 100644 index 0000000..b8f247c --- /dev/null +++ b/keystone/tests/unit/resource/test_controllers.py @@ -0,0 +1,57 @@ +# Copyright 2016 IBM Corp. +# +# Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may +# not use this file except in compliance with the License. See the +# License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations +# under the License. + +import uuid + +from oslo_config import cfg + +from keystone import exception +from keystone.resource import controllers +from keystone.tests import unit +from keystone.tests.unit.ksfixtures import database + + +CONF = cfg.CONF + +_ADMIN_CONTEXT = {'is_admin': True, 'query_string': {}} + + +class TenantTestCaseNoDefaultDomain(unit.TestCase): + + def setUp(self): + super(TenantTestCaseNoDefaultDomain, self).setUp() + self.useFixture(database.Database()) + self.load_backends() + self.tenant_controller = controllers.Tenant() + + def test_setup(self): + # Other tests in this class assume there's no default domain, so make + # sure the setUp worked as expected. + self.assertRaises( + exception.DomainNotFound, + self.resource_api.get_domain, CONF.identity.default_domain_id) + + def test_get_all_projects(self): + # When get_all_projects is done and there's no default domain, the + # result is an empty list. + res = self.tenant_controller.get_all_projects(_ADMIN_CONTEXT) + self.assertEqual([], res['tenants']) + + def test_create_project(self): + # When a project is created using the v2 controller and there's no + # default domain, it doesn't fail with can't find domain (a default + # domain is created) + tenant = {'name': uuid.uuid4().hex} + self.tenant_controller.create_project(_ADMIN_CONTEXT, tenant) + # If the above doesn't fail then this is successful. diff --git a/keystone/tests/unit/resource/test_core.py b/keystone/tests/unit/resource/test_core.py new file mode 100644 index 0000000..f640dc6 --- /dev/null +++ b/keystone/tests/unit/resource/test_core.py @@ -0,0 +1,91 @@ +# Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may +# not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain +# a copy of the License at +# +# http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 +# +# Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software +# distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT +# WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the +# License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations +# under the License. + +import uuid + +from oslo_config import cfg +from oslotest import mockpatch + +from keystone import exception +from keystone.tests import unit +from keystone.tests.unit.ksfixtures import database + + +CONF = cfg.CONF + + +class TestResourceManagerNoFixtures(unit.SQLDriverOverrides, unit.TestCase): + + def setUp(self): + super(TestResourceManagerNoFixtures, self).setUp() + self.useFixture(database.Database(self.sql_driver_version_overrides)) + self.load_backends() + + def test_ensure_default_domain_exists(self): + # When there's no default domain, ensure_default_domain_exists creates + # it. + + # First make sure there's no default domain. + self.assertRaises( + exception.DomainNotFound, + self.resource_api.get_domain, CONF.identity.default_domain_id) + + self.resource_api.ensure_default_domain_exists() + default_domain = self.resource_api.get_domain( + CONF.identity.default_domain_id) + + expected_domain = { + 'id': CONF.identity.default_domain_id, + 'name': 'Default', + 'enabled': True, + 'description': 'Domain created automatically to support V2.0 ' + 'operations.', + } + self.assertEqual(expected_domain, default_domain) + + def test_ensure_default_domain_exists_already_exists(self): + # When there's already a default domain, ensure_default_domain_exists + # doesn't do anything. + + name = uuid.uuid4().hex + description = uuid.uuid4().hex + domain_attrs = { + 'id': CONF.identity.default_domain_id, + 'name': name, + 'description': description, + } + self.resource_api.create_domain(CONF.identity.default_domain_id, + domain_attrs) + + self.resource_api.ensure_default_domain_exists() + + default_domain = self.resource_api.get_domain( + CONF.identity.default_domain_id) + + expected_domain = { + 'id': CONF.identity.default_domain_id, + 'name': name, + 'enabled': True, + 'description': description, + } + + self.assertEqual(expected_domain, default_domain) + + def test_ensure_default_domain_exists_fails(self): + # When there's an unexpected exception creating domain it's passed on. + + self.useFixture(mockpatch.PatchObject( + self.resource_api, 'create_domain', + side_effect=exception.UnexpectedError)) + + self.assertRaises(exception.UnexpectedError, + self.resource_api.ensure_default_domain_exists)

commit_message:
Add new config options for HTTPS store

The patch introduces three new config options: -

disable_https_verification - A way to disable HTTPS Verification
https_ca_bundle - A way to provide a certificate bundle for verification
http_proxy_information - A way to provide proxy information

Implements: blueprint http-store-on-requests

Change-Id: I83066b50405966535cb34faee85601bc79af75fd

added_lines: from oslo_config import cfg _HTTP_OPTS = [ cfg.StrOpt('https_ca_bundle', help=_('Specify a CA bundle file to use in verifying the ' 'remote server certificate.')), cfg.BoolOpt('disable_https_verification', default=True, help=_('If true, the remote server certificate is not ' 'verified. If false, then the default CA truststore is ' 'used for verification. This option is ignored if ' '"https_ca_bundle" is set.')), cfg.DictOpt('http_proxy_information', default={}, help=_('Specify the http/https proxy information that should ' 'be used to connect to the remote server. The proxy ' 'information should be a key value pair of the ' 'scheme and proxy. e.g. http:10.0.0.1:3128. You can ' 'specify proxies for multiple schemes by seperating ' 'the key value pairs with a comma.' 'e.g. http:10.0.0.1:3128, https:10.0.0.1:1080.'))] OPTIONS = _HTTP_OPTS ca_bundle = self.conf.glance_store.https_ca_bundle disable_https = self.conf.glance_store.disable_https_verification self.session.verify = ca_bundle if ca_bundle else not disable_https self.session.proxies = self.conf.glance_store.http_proxy_information

commit_message:
Do not manage compute service within ceilometer compute task

This commit ensures that nova-compute service is enabled in
post-deployment stage only after all the interested parties
have applied their modifications.

Closes-bug: #1548576

Change-Id: I71419fd6446d4af0f93816d92a94415bb3a0fd37

commit_message:
Fix roles attribute for barbican request context

The oslo_context.context.RequestContext was updated in oslo_context 2.2.0
to have a roles attribute. This caused the barbican request context to
have an empty roles attribute.
The 'inspect' library is used to make sure backwards compatibility since
the current requirements for oslo_context is >= 0.2.0.

Change-Id: Iafc67a6f42e46da998eaf2f5199c47f6beaf345e

commit_message:
Add Fuel modular tests spec

Change-Id: Id007d2ec9ef05111a62c929957283d815fd49b11
blueprint: fuel-library-modular-testing
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-specs refs/changes/49/147249/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ============================== Fuel Modular Testing Framework ============================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/fuel/+spec/fuel-library-modular-testing Implement modular testing framework to perform functional and integration testing of puppet modules. Problem description =================== In order to increase engineering velocity and testing coverage we need to add intermediate level of testing that will allow us to test particular puppet modules or integration of particular modules. Proposed change =============== With this framework we introduce the opportunity to run particular puppet manifests on the nodes in the environment after particular dependencies are completed. E.g. in order to test neutron deployment manifests changes we get an environment which already has all the prerequisites executed (base OS, networking, mysql, rabbit, keystone) which is presumable going to be saved into VM snapshot, then we revert the corresponding snapshot, sync system time, upload new manifests to the master node and then deploy corresponding role. After deployment is complete, we execute a bunch of tests which verify that corresponding module deployed what we want and in a way that we want. Alternatives ------------ There are no such frameworks at the moment Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- None Upgrade impact -------------- None Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Dmitry Ilyin aka ~idv1985 TBD: Someone from QA team Aleksandr Didenko aka ~adidenko Work Items ---------- To be filled Dependencies ============ Strong Dependency: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/fuel/+spec/granular-deployment-based-on-tasks Weak Dependency: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/fuel/+spec/fuel-library-modularization Testing ======= TBD Documentation Impact ==================== Corresponding testing documentation should be introduced References ========== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/fuel/+spec/fuel-library-modularization https://blueprints.launchpad.net/fuel/+spec/granular-deployment-based-on-tasks https://docs.google.com/a/mirantis.com/document/d/1GJHr4AHw2qA2wYgngoeN2C-6Dhb7wd1Nm1Q9lkhGCag/edit Please add any useful references here. You are not required to have any reference. Moreover, this specification should still make sense when your references are unavailable. Examples of what you could include are: * Links to mailing list or IRC discussions * Links to relevant research, if appropriate * Related specifications as appropriate * Anything else you feel it is worthwhile to refer to

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-17 11:16:32.000000000', 'files': ['renderspec/__init__.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/renderspec/commit/fc0ae2e4820faf53b676ea1adbd2aea79e1281bd', 'message': "Add EPOCH filter

* Due to different approaches for the EPOCH handling
  used by SUSE and Fedora, this commit adds new filter
  for resolving possible issues related to using of
  EPOCH in package specifications.
* Example:
  - Template J2:
    Name:  {{ 'oslo.config' | py2pkg }}
    Epoch: {{ '2' | epoch }}

  - SUSE:
    Name:  python-oslo.config
    Epoch: 0

  - Fedora:
    Name:  python-oslo-config
    Epoch: 2

Change-Id: Id0459a5ba0db7c2cc7bc7c5d540e7c18a2c0c8e5
"}]
commit_message:
Add EPOCH filter

* Due to different approaches for the EPOCH handling
  used by SUSE and Fedora, this commit adds new filter
  for resolving possible issues related to using of
  EPOCH in package specifications.
* Example:
  - Template J2:
    Name:  {{ 'oslo.config' | py2pkg }}
    Epoch: {{ '2' | epoch }}

  - SUSE:
    Name:  python-oslo.config
    Epoch: 0

  - Fedora:
    Name:  python-oslo-config
    Epoch: 2

Change-Id: Id0459a5ba0db7c2cc7bc7c5d540e7c18a2c0c8e5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/renderspec refs/changes/96/281196/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: env.filters['epoch'] = lambda x: '0' env.filters['epoch'] = _filter_noop

commit_message:
Fix issue in newest_dhcp_lease.py

This fixes a bug in newest_dhcp_lease.py where the get_mac_address
function currently searches for a "bridge" interface instead of
searching for the interface whose source network is
"vagrant-private-dhcp".

Change-Id: Iea0b25f893b959b5e319b117e7a1c4c63a00dd23
Closes-Bug: #1548742

deleted_lines: class NoBridgeInterfaceException(Exception): interface_type = interface.get('type') if interface_type != 'bridge': raise NoBridgeInterfaceException()

commit_message:
Make default limit for search configurable

Currently the default limit is hardcoded to 10, which makes it
inconvenient when we want to change to other value. So make the
default to CONF.limit_param_default.

Change-Id: I709533f677f37b90dc2038e1846e66c05ea42d3e
Closes-Bug: 1549018
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/searchlight refs/changes/51/283451/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: offset=0, limit=None, **kwargs): limit = limit or CONF.limit_param_default

commit_message:
Add collector_restart_interval in agent.yaml

Add collector_restart_interval in agent.yaml
Fix a table format in agent documentation
Add boundary check for the value of collector_restart_interval
Delete --collector_restart_interval and --sub_collection_warn
from monasca-setup

Change-Id: I909e392ed04bc5b2aebc5875860dd6725a00711f

added_lines: | --------- | ----------- | ------------ || monasca_url | This is an optional parameter that specifies the url of the monasca api for retrieving tokens. By default this is obtained from the registered service in keystone. | http://192.168.1.4:8080/v2.0 || detection_plugins | Skip base config and service setup and only configure provided space separated list of plugins. This assumes the base config has already run.| kafka ntp| | overwrite | This is an optional parameter to overwrite the plugin configuration. Use this if you don't want to keep the original configuration. If this parameter is not specified, the configuration will be appended to the existing configuration, possibly creating duplicate checks. **NOTE:** The agent config file, agent.yaml, will always be overwritten, even if this parameter is not specified. | || collector_restart_interval | This is an optional parameter that user can specify an int value as collector_restart_interval (in hour) to restart collector automatically. commit_message:
Added support new v2 API image filters

Added support filtering images based on lists using the 'in' operator.
Filters:
*id
*name
*container_format
*disk_format
*status

DocImpact
ApiImpact
Implements bp: in-filtering-operator

Change-Id: I9cac81b9d5cbec979e88cf2dd0e3b710ed45630c

commit_message:
Add in OVS VIF Driver Framework

This change set adds a new vif driver.  This new vif driver is to be
used in conjunction with the ovs_neutron_agent.  Hybrid vif plugging is
not supported at this time.

This change set assumes that an OVS is running local to the nova-compute
service.

Change-Id: I54d3d4644de55ba4adf43edf034731c4879eaba6

commit_message:
Deprecate Tempest stress tests

As discussed on ML [1], we should have Tempest
more towards it core mission and stress tests framework
is one which does not fit much here.

This commit adds deprecation warning for the Stress tests.

Those will be removed in Newton.

1- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-February/086336.html

Change-Id: I41b42e02ff17f2d98862ddb11f137580abadafde
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/54/283154/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: print("Stress tests are deprecated and will be removed from Tempest " "in the Newton release.")
deleted_lines: LOG.warning("Deprecated: Use 'tempest run-stress' instead. " "The old entrypoint will be removed in a future release.")

commit_message:
Validate volume type extra specs

The main purpose of this spec is to help improve Horizon's user
experience by providing volume type extra specs key/value pair
validation. The current process in Horizon provides no immediate
validation to users. Having a validation done right away while users
are still in the process of creating or editing extra specs will
eliminate problems that could happen at volume creation time which is
much harder to troubleshoot.

blueprint: volume-type-validation
Change-Id: Ia47aa19cf3ce9547ba0d02cbae57e31e104dd4aa
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder-specs refs/changes/80/131280/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ========================================== Validate Volume Type Extra Specs Key/Value ========================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/cinder/+spec/volume-type-validation The purpose of this spec is to enhance the current API call for setting the volume type extra specs key/value pair by including the validation process of the new key/value pair. This enhancement will be used to improve the volume type extra spec management process in Horizon. Problem description =================== The current implementation of volume type extra specs management process in Horizon provides no validation of the extra specs key/value pair. Users have no way to get a response as to whether the extra spec key/value pair they just created is valid or not. The validation of the key/value pair only happens during the volume creation process which is far too late by that point. Having a validation of the key/value pair done immediately within the volume type extra specs creating or editing process will significantly improve the usability and user experience of this task. Proposed change =============== The current REST API to set the volume type extra specs will be enhanced to perform the validation of the new key/value pair before adding the pair to the extra specs. If the validation succeeds, the API will behave exactly as it was before. Otherwise, the API will report the failed validation with a reasonable explanation. Understanding that validation cannot be done easily in some cases, the API can provide a generic explanation as a starting point. More complex solutions can be discussed and worked on in a future enhancement. Alternatives ------------ An alternative of this proposal is the current Horizon process of managing the volume type extra specs which does not provide any validation back to users until the time that they try to create a volume with a certain volume type. By then if there is any issue with the extra specs, the volume creation would fail. It may not be obvious to users that the failure is related to some invalid extra specs. They would have to spend some valuable time researching and probably looking through several log files to identify the problem. Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- Current REST API to be enhanced: * POST /v2/{tenant_id}/types/{type_id}/extra_specs Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- * Horizon will be updated to include the validation of volume type extra specs within the extra specs creating or editing process. Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- Driver developers will need to provide a new driver method that performs the extra specs key/value pair validation. It is completely up to the driver to decide how to validate each key/value pair. It can choose to do nothing and report a successful validation. It can choose to simply validate if the type of the value is as expected. It can also choose to validate against the array of supported values to ensure that the value is legitimate and usable. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: jgravel (julie.gravel@hp.com) Other contributors: TBD Work Items ---------- * Add support for extra-specs-validate command to python-cinderclient * Add support for extra-specs-validate command to cinder.volumes.manager * Add support for extra-specs-validate command to all supported drivers Dependencies ============ Horizon blueprint that will depend on this spec: * https://blueprints.launchpad.net/horizon/+spec/vol-type-extra-specs-validate Testing ======= Unit tests for all changed files Documentation Impact ==================== * The cinder client documentation will need to be updated to reflect the new command. * The cinder API documentation will need to be updated to reflect the new REST API. References ========== None

commit_message:
Support of PyMySQL driver for MySQL backend

Add ability to use python-pymysql library
as backend for MySQL connections.
Update acceptance tests to use pyMySQL.
Docs: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/PyMySQL_evaluation
The same implementation as it's done for keystone:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/242134/

Change-Id: If41a86abc3090dfb439d09cd63ae2ecb9a0b9598
(cherry picked from commit ae60c149f299c7e623726906bdc7b25856061233)

commit_message:
Remove legacy patching code

In Fuel 5.1 we had an experimental feature - 'patching openstack env'.
The idea was to update and to rollback OpenStack environments between
minor releases. However, we have encounter a lot of problems with
restoring OpenStack databases andresolving dependency hell in packages,
so we buried it and never release it.

This patch removes legacy code from the source tree. We can do it
without fear, since it wasn't released in public.

Related-Bug: #1511499
Change-Id: I58b3fedd239eb7fe4226e51c2d6386efab14395d

expected_priorities = [ {'role': 'zabbix-server', 'priority': 100}, {'role': 'mongo', 'priority': 200}, {'role': 'primary-mongo', 'priority': 300}, {'role': 'primary-controller', 'priority': 400}, subject: Xen: Calculate block_migration if it's None
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-07 10:03:06.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/4987d0234f21cd9e9787e244feadb601a1140f4c', 'message': "Calculate block_migration in virt drivers if it's None

This patch will calculate block_migration value(True/False) if it was set
to None, also if disk_over_commit is None, libvirt driver will ignore
disk usage checking.

Bump up nova compute rpc version from 4.5 to 4.6 since if newer rpc client
pass disk_over_commit=None or block_migration=None, older compute manager won't
understand it.

Partially implements: blueprint making-live-migration-api-friendly
Co-authored-by: Alex Xu <hejie.xu@intel.com>
Change-Id: I85047d44e388c89938f80ad8be1724bd11ed0225

commit_message:
Xen: Calculate block_migration if it's None

This patch will calculate block_migration value(True/False) if it was
not set during check_can_live_migrate_destination.

Partially implements: blueprint
making-live-migration-api-friendly
Change-Id: I85047d44e388c89938f80ad8be1724bd11ed0225

commit_message:
Add verbose logging for multibyte unicode errors

volume create with unicode name results in HTTP 400
with little detailing.

Adding verbose to same.

Change-Id: I48f07d090945043fcfc8bca0db23944f56e95610

added_lines: try: REGEX_4BYTE_UNICODE = re.compile(u'[\U00010000-\U0010ffff]') except re.error: # UCS-2 build case REGEX_4BYTE_UNICODE = re.compile(u'[\uD800-\uDBFF][\uDC00-\uDFFF]') def unicode_check_4byte(name): """Checks that no 4 byte unicode characters are allowed in string parameters """ if (REGEX_4BYTE_UNICODE.findall(name) != []): return True else: return False

Revert "Remove Murano installation from Fuel from box"

This partially reverts commit 21fcbbc5aedbdb746553346b77413a4671fd1b02.

This patch reverts only python part.

The new way of removing Murano is described here:
https://review.openstack.org/275124

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web refs/changes/28/285328/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Important notes for Murano tests -------------------------------- * Murano is deprecated in Fuel 9.0. * Put Murano image `ubuntu-murano-agent.qcow2 <http://sahara-files.mirantis.com/ubuntu-murano-agent.qcow2>`_ (md5: b0a0fdc0b4a8833f79701eb25e6807a3) in /tmp before start. * Running Murano tests on instances without an Internet connection will fail. * For Murano tests execute 'export SLAVE_NODE_MEMORY=5120' before starting.

commit_message:
Added ssh-user parameter to dump configuration

Since Shotgun uses SSH to access other nodes, it needs
to have a correct username to log in as instead of root.

Change-Id: I7c2c47efbae3222d1ebd2cc455394bcdac05511e
Blueprint: fuel-nonroot-openstack-nodes

commit_message:
Use IPv4 for Tenant Tunneling Network with IPv6 Deployment

Neutron and Open vSwitch do not support IPv6 tunnel endpoints, so it
doesn't make sense to configure the Tenant network as IPv6 until
it is supported. This change makes the Tenant network IPv4, so that
VXLAN/GRE tunnels will work without modifying the resource_registry.

Change-Id: I024855d312df6aee38e84303afbba91595b86643
(cherry picked from commit 00ef275566c914f43760141ec309c6d29eecece0)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/70/279770/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Enable the creation of IPv6 Neutron networks for isolated Overcloud # traffic and configure each role to assign ports (related # to that role) on these networks. resource_registry: OS::TripleO::Network::External: ../network/external_v6.yaml OS::TripleO::Network::InternalApi: ../network/internal_api_v6.yaml OS::TripleO::Network::StorageMgmt: ../network/storage_mgmt_v6.yaml OS::TripleO::Network::Storage: ../network/storage_v6.yaml # IPv4 until OVS and Neutron support IPv6 tunnel endpoints OS::TripleO::Network::Tenant: ../network/tenant.yaml # Port assignments for the VIPs OS::TripleO::Network::Ports::ExternalVipPort: ../network/ports/external_v6.yaml OS::TripleO::Network::Ports::InternalApiVipPort: ../network/ports/internal_api_v6.yaml OS::TripleO::Network::Ports::StorageVipPort: ../network/ports/storage_v6.yaml OS::TripleO::Network::Ports::StorageMgmtVipPort: ../network/ports/storage_mgmt_v6.yaml OS::TripleO::Network::Ports::RedisVipPort: ../network/ports/vip_v6.yaml # Port assignments for the controller role OS::TripleO::Controller::Ports::ExternalPort: ../network/ports/external_v6.yaml OS::TripleO::Controller::Ports::InternalApiPort: ../network/ports/internal_api_v6.yaml OS::TripleO::Controller::Ports::StoragePort: ../network/ports/storage_v6.yaml OS::TripleO::Controller::Ports::StorageMgmtPort: ../network/ports/storage_mgmt_v6.yaml OS::TripleO::Controller::Ports::TenantPort: ../network/ports/tenant.yaml # Port assignments for the compute role OS::TripleO::Compute::Ports::InternalApiPort: ../network/ports/internal_api_v6.yaml OS::TripleO::Compute::Ports::StoragePort: ../network/ports/storage_v6.yaml OS::TripleO::Compute::Ports::TenantPort: ../network/ports/tenant.yaml # Port assignments for the ceph storage role OS::TripleO::CephStorage::Ports::StoragePort: ../network/ports/storage_v6.yaml OS::TripleO::CephStorage::Ports::StorageMgmtPort: ../network/ports/storage_mgmt_v6.yaml # Port assignments for the swift storage role OS::TripleO::SwiftStorage::Ports::InternalApiPort: ../network/ports/internal_api_v6.yaml OS::TripleO::SwiftStorage::Ports::StoragePort: ../network/ports/storage_v6.yaml OS::TripleO::SwiftStorage::Ports::StorageMgmtPort: ../network/ports/storage_mgmt_v6.yaml # Port assignments for the block storage role OS::TripleO::BlockStorage::Ports::InternalApiPort: ../network/ports/internal_api_v6.yaml OS::TripleO::BlockStorage::Ports::StoragePort: ../network/ports/storage_v6.yaml OS::TripleO::BlockStorage::Ports::StorageMgmtPort: ../network/ports/storage_mgmt_v6.yaml parameter_defaults: # Enable IPv6 for MongoDB. This is required when MongoDB is using an IPv6 IP. MongoDbIPv6: True # Enable various IPv6 features in Nova. NovaIPv6: True

commit_message:
Add heat client support for Resource set health

Add a new command to  set resource's health.
The command takes the following format:
heat resource-mark-unhealthy [--reset]
                        <NAME or ID> <RESOURCE>
                        reason

Change-Id: I4e0a127343e591c176f451172a1c8a59bf36f6eb
Partially-implements: blueprint mark-unhealthy
Depends-On: Ifa48b179723a2100fff548467db9e162bc669d13

added_lines: def test_mark_unhealthy(self): fields = {'stack_id': 'teststack', 'resource_name': 'testresource', 'data': {'mark_unhealthy': 'True', 'status_reason': 'Anything'}} expect = ('PATCH', '/stacks/teststack%2Fabcd1234/resources' '/testresource/mark_unhealthy') key = 'mark_unhealthy' manager = self._base_test(expect, key) manager.mark_unhealthy(**fields) self.m.VerifyAll()

commit_message:
Libvirt: Calculate block_migration if it's None

This patch will calculate block_migration value(True/False) if it was
not set, also if disk_over_commit is None, libvirt driver will ignore
disk usage checking.

Partially implements: blueprint making-live-migration-api-friendly
Change-Id: I07d3cbac4d893cd12877ab535ca59b69b1156ff2

commit_message:
Store all the fixed ips of a port in one entry in Logical_Port.addresses

If a port has three IPs - (IP1, IP2, IP3), it will be stored
as ["MAC IP1 IP2 IP31"] instead of ["MAC IP1", "MAC IP2", "MAC IP3"].

With this fix, ovn-northd will not add duplicate flows in
ls_in_l2_lkup (ingress table 3) pipeline.

The code to support multiple entries in Logical_Port.addresses is
merged in ovn-northd.

Change-Id: I08ef70d7d1cf6bf5477a9af0a7cb3b8bcb5b7ab3
Closes-bug: #1536927
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn refs/changes/26/271226/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ipv4_addrs = '' ipv6_addrs = '' for ip in port.get('fixed_ips') or []: if netaddr.IPAddress(ip['ip_address']).version == 4: ipv4_addrs += ' ' + ip['ip_address'] else: ipv6_addrs += ' ' + ip['ip_address'] addresses = [port['mac_address'] + ipv4_addrs + ipv6_addrs]
deleted_lines: addresses = [port['mac_address'] + ' ' + ip['ip_address'] for ip in port['fixed_ips']]

commit_message:
continue to delete next node if failed with previous one

We delete multiple nodes which include the non-exist nodes, ironic
client will break at the node which non-exist, so with this patch,
we will add try-except logic to continue to delete next one, and
print the results which are deleted and which are failed.

Change-Id: Iba48c570e48b51a2b6029ae89e3163ed05184bc1
Close-bug: #1529894

commit_message:
Mock key manager takes configuration as an arg

To make the mock key manager align more with the other key manager
back ends, change mock key manager's __init__ to take an arg for the
configuration values.

Change-Id: I7a327987ebab64b75b348353ef4658a051777d96
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/castellan refs/changes/34/272234/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def __init__(self, configuration): self.conf = configuration

commit_message:
Fix scenario tests for correct output to swift

Scenario framework used swift-output as swift-input.
Now is fixed
closes-bug: #1524720

commit_message:
Refactoring of system_test classes

Some design of system_test packages:
    - move actions to separate package
    - move core fuctionality to core package

Change-Id: I7b12380a687c9cccbd44d79819f842b1b2470cd5
Implemets blueprint template-based-testcases

commit_message:
Adds Ceph RADOS Gateway monitoring to ceph plugin

Adds ceph-radosgw service monitoring capability
to the existing ceph plugin, which contains ceph-osd,
ceph-monitor and ceph-mds services. Also refactored
code for better readability

Change-Id: I87455d77364c68d377a2704b16a468b6cfabd0f1
Implements: blueprint ceph-plugin-radosgw-enhancement
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/monasca-agent refs/changes/71/280171/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.process_names = ['ceph-osd', 'ceph-mon', 'ceph-mds', 'radosgw'] self.ceph_rgw_executable = '/usr/bin/radosgw' self.found_processes = list() search_strings = list() def _mon_config(self, cluster_name): expected_processes = list() if os.path.exists(self.ceph_mon_path) else list() return expected_processes def _osd_config(self, cluster_name): expected_processes = list() # Get the list of daemon identifiers osd_list = os.listdir(self.ceph_osd_path) \ if os.path.exists(self.ceph_osd_path) else list() for osd in osd_list: # OSD daemon identifier is of format <cluster_name>-<id> # Where 'id' is a unique numeric index for that OSD in the cluster # E.g., ceph-1, ceph-2 etc. daemon_id = osd.split(cluster_name + '-', 1)[1] process = dict() process_args = ['--cluster %s' % cluster_name, '--id %s' % daemon_id, '-f'] process['search_string'] = self._build_search_string( self.ceph_osd_executable, process_args) process['name'] = '%s-osd.%s' % (cluster_name, daemon_id) process['type'] = 'ceph-osd' expected_processes.append(process) return expected_processes def _mds_config(self, cluster_name): expected_processes = list() # Get the list of daemon identifiers mds_list = os.listdir(self.ceph_mds_path) \ if os.path.exists(self.ceph_mds_path) else list() for mds in mds_list: # MDS daemon identifier is of format <cluster_name>-<id> return expected_processes def _radosgw_config(self, cluster_name, config_file): expected_processes = list() # RADOS Gateway processes is of the format: # /usr/bin/radosgw -c <config_file> -n <rados_username> # E.g., # /usr/bin/radosgw -c /etc/ceph/ceph.conf -n client.radosgw.gateway process = dict() process['search_string'] = list() process['name'] = '%s-radosgw' % cluster_name process['type'] = 'ceph-radosgw' # Trivial configuration with only rados username process_options = ['-n client.radosgw.', '--name=client.radosgw.'] for opt in process_options: process['search_string'].extend(self._build_search_string( self.ceph_rgw_executable, [opt])) # Configuration with rados username and config file process_options = ['-c %s' % config_file, '--conf=%s' % config_file, '-n client.radosgw.', '--name=client.radosgw.'] for comb in itertools.combinations(process_options, 2): # Fetch all combinations, filter duplicate params and # add all permutations to search_string process_args = ' '.join(comb) if '-c ' in process_args and '--conf' in process_args: continue if '-n ' in process_args and '--name' in process_args: continue process_args = list(comb) process['search_string'].extend(self._build_search_string( self.ceph_rgw_executable, process_args)) expected_processes.append(process) return expected_processes def build_config(self): """Build the config as a Plugins object and return. """ config = agent_config.Plugins() # Default cluster name cluster_name = 'ceph' config_file = '/etc/ceph/ceph.conf' # Get the cluster_name from <cluster_name>.conf in /etc/ceph/ directory if os.path.exists(self.ceph_config_dir): config_files = [f for f in os.listdir(self.ceph_config_dir) if f.endswith('.conf')] if not config_files: return config config_file = config_files[0] cluster_name = config_file[:-5] expected_processes = list() expected_processes.extend(self._mon_config(cluster_name)) expected_processes.extend(self._osd_config(cluster_name)) expected_processes.extend(self._mds_config(cluster_name)) expected_processes.extend(self._radosgw_config( cluster_name, config_file))

commit_message:
Documentation: File_size plugin

Change-Id: Ida1539ca5acf8302abafcd3f2e305d7f1ced465d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/monasca-agent refs/changes/80/280780/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: | file_size | | | ## File Size Checks This section describes the file size check that can be performed by the Agent. File size checks are used for gathering the size of individual files or the size of each file under a specific directory. The agent supports additional functionality through the use of Python scripts. A YAML file (file_size.yaml) contains the list of file directory names and file names to check. A Python script (file_size.py) runs checks each host in turn to gather stats. Similar to other checks, the configuration is done in YAML, and consists of two keys: init_config and instances. The former is not used by file_size, while the later contains one or more sets of file directory name and file names to check, plus optional parameter recursive. When recursive is true and file_name is set to '*', file_size check will take all the files under the given directory recursively. Sample config: ``` init_config: null instances: - built_by: FileSize directory_name: /var/log/monasca/agent/ file_names: - '*' recursive: false - built_by: FileSize directory_name: /var/log/monasca/api file_names: - monasca-api.log - request.log recursive: false - built_by: FileSize directory_name: /var/log/monasca/notification file_names: - notification.log recursive: false ``` The file_size checks return the following metrics: | Metric Name | Dimensions | | ----------- | ---------- | | file.size_bytes | file_name, directory_name, hostname, service |

commit_message:
Warn against using neutron-db-manage expand/contract yet

The separate expand/contract migrations are not yet functional for the
Liberty -> Mitaka upgrade.

Change-Id: I75b55b19eef5899c2ee80191553f6d4e336127c5

added_lines: Since Liberty, Networking maintains two parallel Alembic migration branches. However, the Neutron database schema does not support separate branch migrations for the Liberty -> Mitaka upgrade. The intention is to support them for the Mitaka -> Newton upgrade.
deleted_lines: Since Liberty, Networking maintains two parallel Alembic migration branches.

commit_message:
Gate: Enable 'Depends-On' cross-repo dependent patching for plugins

When 'Depends-On: <change-id>' is used in a patch, Zuul clones all the
patches into the same directory. This patch ensures that if the plugins
repository is cloned due to this method being used, it prefers the use
of the cloned plugin repository above the currently merged master clone.

Change-Id: Iadd542eb76b157e6bf9a37debf2b0aff75fb9a36
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/17/285217/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # When 'Depends-On: <change-id>' is used in a patch, Zuul clones all the # patches into the same directory. We need to ensure that this directory # is preferred for plugins is the additional repository cloned happens # to be the plugin repository. if [ -d "$(dirname ${0})/../openstack-ansible-plugins" ]; then sed -i "s|/etc/ansible/plugins|$(dirname ${0})/../openstack-ansible-plugins|" ansible.cfg fi # Jenkins logs don't need colorised output # Jenkins logs don't need colorised output # When 'Depends-On: <change-id>' is used in a patch, Zuul clones all the # patches into the same directory. We need to ensure that this directory # is preferred for plugins is the additional repository cloned happens # to be the plugin repository. if [ -d "$(dirname ${0})/../openstack-ansible-plugins" ]; then sed -i "s|/etc/ansible/plugins|$(dirname ${0})/../openstack-ansible-plugins|" ansible.cfg fi

the rabbit endpoint gets a connection refused error.

commit_message:
encode auth token in swiftclient log message

swiftclient logs sensitive info in headers when logging http requests
in debug mode.
this patch is to hide sensitive info in headers such as 'X-Auth-Token'

with this patch, debug info likes lines follow (replace some chars with
star char *)

DEBUG:swiftclient:RESP HEADERS:
[('Content-Length', '0'),
('X-Trans-Id', 'tx3cb474794ed84c65a1907-0056c6a2ad'),
('X-Auth-Token-Expires', '77809'),
('X-Auth-Token', 'AUTH_tkee9*****************************'),
('X-Storage-Token', 'AUTH_tkee9*****************************'),
('Date', 'Fri, 19 Feb 2016 05:05:49 GMT'),
('X-Storage-Url', 'http://127.0.0.1:8080/v1/AUTH_admin'),
('Content-Type', 'text/html; charset=UTF-8')]

Closes-bug:#1516692

Change-Id: Ifaa468e489a31b3ede5fa8ad30c7b0717345e11b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-swiftclient refs/changes/73/259273/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import hashlibSENSITIVE_HEADERS = ('X-Auth-Token', 'X-Subject-Token',)def safe_header(name, value): if name in SENSITIVE_HEADERS and value: v = value.encode('utf-8') h = hashlib.sha1(v) d = h.hexdigest() return name, "{SHA1}%s" % d else: return (name, value) header = ' -H "%s: %s"' % safe_header(element, kwargs['headers'][element])

commit_message:
Set sahara-api and sahara-engine process count to 2 in sahara system tests

sahara-api has one process with root priv and forks (corresponding to
api_workers parameter in sahara.conf. By default fork numbers is one.
So sahara-api count should be equal to 2.

sahara-engine process count is hardcoded to 2.

Change-Id: I252c2a00bd63294c7ee148e142358c9cc4c7ec41
Closes-Bug: #1550021

commit_message:
Use poll_for_events for "openstack stack <action>"

These are treated like the poll_for_events for stack update, except for
the cancel action which stops polling on any COMPLETE or FAILED state.

Change-Id: I3723bde4f26abb12674d15df65764fb6d8a67a56
Blueprint: heat-support-python-openstackclient

commit_message:
Add start directory for oslo_debug_helper

When I used `tox -e debug <test-name>` to test a case, the case did not
run properly and there is an error like this:

ImportError: Start directory is not importable: './python-watcher/tests'

If we use '-t wartcher/tests' to point out the test path, the case will
run properly under debug.
So we'd better add this start directory for oslo_debug_helper.

Change-Id: I04d9937f72a95f8f045129af08df0cd0d0870d39
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/watcher refs/changes/42/283142/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Adding UsePAM check for SSH inside the os_swift role

This fix wil add a check if UsePAM has been enabled
inside the sshd configuration. Without having this
feature enabled, the swift user can't login into other
nodes at least in the current configuration.

Change-Id: I9307bdce32ab08298cb1b69b8776f87ae0e76a4d
Closes-Bug: #1549379

commit_message:
Add more infomation when create cluster failed for scenario test

The create cluster step in scenario test is prone to get failed.
Provide more information of the failure to make it easier to debug.

Change-Id: Ic0509ce610f56e209ea38dce7ee7576704d08400

commit_message:
Add functional test for immutable parameters

Co-Authored-By: Jason Dunsmore <jasondunsmore@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I0f978e67ecbcaec65222f449cd41f20c768e9937
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/74/262274/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from heat_integrationtests.functional import functional_base from heatclient import exc as heat_exceptions class ImmutableParametersTest(functional_base.FunctionalTestsBase): template_param_has_no_updatable_field = ''' heat_template_version: 2014-10-16 parameters: param1: type: string default: default_value resources: test_rsrc: type: OS::Heat::TestResource properties: value: { get_param: param1 } outputs: param1_output: description: 'parameter 1 details' value: { get_param: param1 } ''' template_param_has_updatable_field = ''' heat_template_version: 2014-10-16 parameters: param1: type: string default: default_value updatable: true resources: test_rsrc: type: OS::Heat::TestResource properties: value: { get_param: param1 } outputs: param1_output: description: 'parameter 1 details' value: { get_param: param1 } ''' def setUp(self): super(ImmutableParametersTest, self).setUp() def test_no_updatable_param_field(self): param1_create_value = 'value1' create_parameters = {"param1": param1_create_value} stack_identifier = self.stack_create( template=self.template_param_has_no_updatable_field, parameters=create_parameters ) stack = self.client.stacks.get(stack_identifier) # Verify the value of the parameter for out in stack.outputs: if out['output_key'] == 'param1_output': self.assertEqual(param1_create_value, out['output_value']) param1_update_value = 'value2' update_parameters = {"param1": param1_update_value} self.update_stack( stack_identifier, template=self.template_param_has_no_updatable_field, parameters=update_parameters) stack = self.client.stacks.get(stack_identifier) # Verify the value of the updated parameter for out in stack.outputs: if out['output_key'] == 'param1_output': self.assertEqual(param1_update_value, out['output_value']) def test_updatable_param_field(self): param1_create_value = 'value1' create_parameters = {"param1": param1_create_value} stack_identifier = self.stack_create( template=self.template_param_has_updatable_field, parameters=create_parameters ) stack = self.client.stacks.get(stack_identifier) # Verify the value of the parameter for out in stack.outputs: if out['output_key'] == 'param1_output': self.assertEqual(param1_create_value, out['output_value']) param1_update_value = 'value2' update_parameters = {"param1": param1_update_value} self.update_stack( stack_identifier, template=self.template_param_has_updatable_field, parameters=update_parameters) stack = self.client.stacks.get(stack_identifier) # Verify the value of the updated parameter for out in stack.outputs: if out['output_key'] == 'param1_output': self.assertNotEqual(param1_create_value, out['output_value']) self.assertEqual(param1_update_value, out['output_value']) # toggle the updatable field to preclude updating updatable_false = self.template_param_has_updatable_field.replace( 'updatable: true', 'updatable: false') # create a new stack based on the revised template stack_identifier = self.stack_create( template=updatable_false, parameters=create_parameters ) stack = self.client.stacks.get(stack_identifier) # Verify the value of the parameter for out in stack.outputs: if out['output_key'] == 'param1_output': self.assertEqual(param1_create_value, out['output_value']) # Attempt to update the stack with a new parameter value try: self.update_stack( stack_identifier, template=updatable_false, parameters=update_parameters) except heat_exceptions.HTTPInternalServerError as exc: exp = ('ERROR: Remote error: ImmutableParameterModified The ' 'Parameter (param1) is immutable and may not be updated') self.assertIn(exp, str(exc)) stack = self.client.stacks.get(stack_identifier) # Ensure immutable parameter has not changed for out in stack.outputs: if out['output_key'] == 'param1_output': self.assertEqual(param1_create_value, out['output_value'])

subject: libvirt: Fix/implement revert-resize for RBD-backed images
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-28 15:42:51.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/121845672d074d9b78ea946a5a4848d46e28a3bc', 'message': 'libvirt: Fix/implement revert-resize for RBD-backed images

* Makes a snapshot of Ceph-backed roots prior to resize
* Rolls back to snapshot on revert
* Destroys resize snapshots on image cleanup

implement their own workalike methods, if doing so makes sense.

commit_message:
libvirt: Fix/implement revert-resize for RBD-backed images

* Makes a snapshot of Ceph-backed roots prior to resize
* Rolls back to snapshot on revert
* Destroys resize snapshots on image cleanup

Conflicts:
    nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py

because (I70215fb25ef25422786b96d33c91d8f1d4760a23) isn't on liberty

(cherry picked from commit 29476a67d4d4ff7eedd97f589422d47015111448)

Closes-Bug: 1369465
Closes-Bug: 1314526
Change-Id: I328d2c41696a9c0f090f822a51ea42fac83f62ec

commit_message:
make fwaas plugin and driver configurable

user can pass fwaas plugin and driver from localrc

(cherry-picked from commit 8eab6ad31b7d34f26c912e7c1e60d39bf596124a)
Change-Id: Id956d4d7e62ba81f77319c199c9cb9f354b13d12

commit_message:
Disable IPv6 on bridge devices in LinuxBridgeManager

We don't want to create a bridge device with an IPv6 address because
it will see the Router Advertisement from Neutron.

Conflicts:
	neutron/agent/linux/bridge_lib.py

Change-Id: If59a823804d3477c5d8877f46fcc4c018af57a5a
Closes-bug: 1302080
(cherry picked from commit 404eaead793b3192982ae247685970973609be1f)

commit_message:
Designate V2 - Add recordset scenarios

Add create_and_(list|delete)_recordset scenarios
Remove the test also that checks the allowed methods, this is in order for us
to be able to have a private method _walk_pages that will do fetching of pages
for us vs attempting to fetch 1 giant list at once.

Change-Id: I43b111ebe07f3842fce48af4898978130d1341d7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rally refs/changes/14/249314/16 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _create_recordset(self, zone, recordset=None, atomic_action=True): """Create a recordset in a zone. :param zone: zone dict :param recordset: recordset dict :param atomic_action: True if the recordset creation should be tracked as an atomic action :returns: Designate recordset dict """ recordset = recordset or {} recordset.setdefault("type_", recordset.pop("type", "A")) recordset.setdefault("name", "%s.%s" % (self.generate_random_name(), zone["name"])) recordset.setdefault("records", ["10.0.0.1"]) client = self.clients("designate", version="2") if atomic_action: with atomic.ActionTimer(self, "designate.create_recordset"): return client.recordsets.create(zone["id"], **recordset) return client.recordsets.create(zone["id"], **recordset) def _delete_recordset(self, zone_id, recordset_id, atomic_action=True): """Delete a zone recordset. :param zone_id: Zone ID :param recordset_id: Recordset ID :param atomic_action: True if the recordset creation should be tracked as an atomic action """ client = self.clients("designate", version="2") if atomic_action: with atomic.ActionTimer(self, "designate.delete_recordset"): client.recordsets.delete(zone_id, recordset_id) else: client.recordsets.delete(zone_id, recordset_id)

subject: WIP: PoC: Add cell mapping for instances
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-16 17:20:00.000000000', 'files': ['nova/conductor/manager.py', 'nova/objects/instance.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/4ea43084097ebff80d5ddb33c67dc346a2fa5701', 'message': 'WIP: PoC: Add cell mapping for instances

Add a cell mapping for instances.

Add an example switch to cell0 when an instance fails to be scheduled.

Seems like the code for managing instance mappings should go in the
instance object. The code for where instances are created and deleted is
pretty complex, putting it in the object means we are less likely to
miss a case.

Writing instances to cell0 should just be a cell switch and writing the
instance out in the normal manner. (Along with the mapping)

Change-Id: I2607e2f4462bca76f88f9b0cdc3273d5d282b885
'}]
commit_message:
WIP: PoC: Add cell mapping for instances

Add a cell mapping for instances.

Add an example switch to cell0 when an instance fails to be scheduled.

Seems like the code for managing instance mappings should go in the
instance object. The code for where instances are created and deleted is
pretty complex, putting it in the object means we are less likely to
miss a case.

Writing instances to cell0 should just be a cell switch and writing the
instance out in the normal manner. (Along with the mapping)

Change-Id: I2607e2f4462bca76f88f9b0cdc3273d5d282b885
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/34/280834/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from nova.obects.instance_mapping import InstanceMapping inst_mapping = objects.InstanceMapping(context, instance_uuid=self.id, cell_id=objects.context.cell_uuid) inst_mapping.save() inst_mapping = objects.InstanceMapping.get_by_instance_uuid(context, self.id) inst_mapping.destroy()

commit_message:
Install IPA in a virtual environment

In order to avoid conflict with installing dependencies for IPA from
pypi and distribution packages this patch propose installing IPA in a
virtual environment.

Closes-Bug: #1506792
Change-Id: I6a4c6403813d86f4110e98449ddd874109101b9e

commit_message:
Allow enabling debug level via kernel cmdline

Adds a new kernel option "ipa-debug" which can be set to "1" or "true" to
enable debug logging.

Change-Id: Iafe9a9b8b718280920005726e0f7e69e3f0a320c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-python-agent refs/changes/05/284705/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - Debug logging can no be enabled by setting "ipa-debug" kernel parameter.

commit_message:
Agent specific API for L2 agent extensions

This proposal should be quick to implement and unblock extensions
interested in injecting OpenFlow rules; while we work on a more long
term solution that would manage feature flows in a more controlled way.

Change-Id: I0c6937a747a7930f08a494cf237b6e50f141a49c
Partial-Bug: #1517903
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-specs refs/changes/19/263819/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ========================================== Agent specific API for L2 agent extensions ========================================== https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1517903 In Liberty, so called L2 agent extensions were introduced. Those extensions are triggered on specific events (particularly, on port updates and deletes), but they have no way to interact with the agent. Some features currently in development (SFC, QoS DSCP, others) require some level of coordination with the agent that is running those extensions. Problem Description =================== One major use case where extensions may need to coordinate with the agent that is running them is the Open vSwitch agent graceful restart feature added in Liberty cycle. For this feature, a per-session agent id is used to distinguish flows that belong to the current agent session from those that belong to the previous one. The problem starts when an extension wants to inject its own flows into the switch. Since those extensions don't have a way to determine what the current agent id is, they cannot mark their new flows with it, which results in the agent dropping all their flows on restart assuming they are stale. Providing access to the Open vSwitch agent id to L2 agent extensions will be the first reference agent specific API that will be exposed through the new proposed mechanism. Proposed Change =============== The proposal will extend the L2 agent extensions API to pass an agent specific API object into the extensions manager. After that, each agent that relies on those extensions will be able to define the agent specific API, while extensions that are interested in interacting with the agent will be able to distinguish the agent that is running them inspecting the driver_type argument that is already passed into extension initialize() method. Since extensions can be maintained outside the Neutron tree, we should consider not breaking them with later agent API changes. With that goal in mind, the agent API will be versioned from the very start (using oslo.versionedobjects library), so that extensions can 'backport' the API object to a version they know how to handle in case they are not updated to handle the latest one. Since out of tree agents could already rely on extensions mechanism, the new API object argument will be optional in the extensions manager and in extensions themselves. All three reference agents (Open vSwitch, Linuxbridge, SR-IOV) will be updated to pass an API object of corresponding type into L2 agent extensions. For the start, those objects will be stubs, not providing any useful methods. Later, the APIs will be extended when needs arise. As part of the proposal, the Open vSwitch agent API object will receive a new field to store the agent id for the current session that will allow to implement extensions that inject their flows.

commit_message:
Rebase on LogicalUnit.name @property setter

Recent pypowervm commit 5f4e66ff1a7c6b335b881dcf8daac7414abc1f3a exposed
the private _name method of LogicalUnit as a public @property setter.
Rebase on the change.

Change-Id: I8065aeea33d95189bcc2df74dd882cb98605ba5c

commit_message:
Return BadRequest for invalid Unicode names

If the database fails to insert values due to them
containing Unicode that the database can't support (or other
similar errors that fall under DBDataError), return an
HTTP 400 Bad Request rather than HTTP 500.

this patch give fix for

1. backup-create Creates a volume backup.
2. cgsnapshot-create Creates a cgsnapshot.
3. consisgroup-create Creates a consistency group.
4. encryption-type-create Creates encryption-type
5. qos-create Creates a qos specs.
6. snapshot-create Creates a snapshot.
7. type-create Creates a volume type.
8. update/edit of entities mentioned in step1-7 update/edit name.
   ( is already taken care)

   this patch do not give fix for volume create as is taken care by

       https://review.openstack.org/#/c/266036

fixed some tab and space issue

Change-Id: I06cbf84f884ab93935f8f9fc85a02ac7a36363eb
Closes-bug: #1531400

commit_message:
Automate setting of glance_api_version

When integrating ceph w/ OpenStack, we suggest setting
glance_api_version to 2 in the cinder_backends section for the ceph
backend in question.  This allows cinder to create clones from glance
snapshots when glance uses RBD as a storage mechanism.

The problem is that glance_api_version needs to be set in [DEFAULT],
and not in the backend's section in cinder.conf.

This change adds a new user variable cinder_glance_api_version, and if
the environment has a cinder RBD backend and has glance configured to
use RBD it will then set glance_api_version in cinder.conf to 2.  If
these conditions are not met, then it will use version 1 (the default).

Change-Id: I242cd5b1e7eb47ee76c1f3cb0169e3b5d070959c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/08/283508/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: glance_api_version = {{ cinder_glance_api_version }}

commit_message:
Fix port relationship for DVRPortBinding

uselist=False is used for one to one relationship, but for
DVRPortBinding, a router_interface_distributed port can have
multiple bindings. That causes SAWarning:
Multiple rows returned with uselist=False for lazily-loaded attribute
'Port.dvr_port_binding'.

"uselist=False" is misused in DVRPortBinding port relationship,
this patch will fix this.

Change-Id: I2b00d96aaa445e0977bc3d4957d35a28d44dd953
Closes-Bug: #1540259

commit_message:
Unmarshall portinfo on update_fdb_entries calls

The unmarshalling function was not aware of the data
structure used by update_fdb_entries, so it would not
setup PortInfo named tuples in the 'before' and 'after'
fields. This would break the fdb_chg_ip_tun function
which expected to be able to use named attributes.

This patch adjusts the unmarshalling function to be aware
of this datastrucure.

This has likely been broken since the change that added
named tuples here: I7f8c93b0e12ee0179bb23dfbb3a3d814615b1c2e
It probably went undetected for so long because the exception
will only be observed when the updated entry does not have
an agent IP that matches the local agent's (i.e. not single-node).
Even in a multi-node environment, this would only trigger an
error when the fixed_ips of a port changed so it wouldn't show
up in a normal port wiring life-cycle.

Closes-Bug: #1538387
Change-Id: I0aacb3af9ebd160ebfb801f77b186075303c3df5

commit_message:
Add support for Apache mod_wsgi

Enhance server.py to support mod_wsgi
so it can be used with Apache
and update the README as well

Change-Id: I8d600ad78cb5c7fd7763bd230b85985c4dda1ae8

commit_message:
Added pycrypto to requirements for module support

In order to decrypt the contents of the module data,
the pycrypto package needs to be available on the guest.

Change-Id: I779c24472d3d96a7b2fe4ed0284fd5869cdef93b
Partially-Implements: blueprint module-management

commit_message:
Add tests for RPC methods/classes

The public methods and classes within the neutron.common.rpc module are
untested. This adds tests for all public-facing functions within the
module.

Closes-Bug: #1535327
Change-Id: I80227dd73e58f8b5dbde9cea01ceac22cc8b2e34

commit_message:
Add more log when dhcp agent sync_state.

DHCP agent output no log when synchronizing network state, it's hard to observe
agent work state through log.

Add log to indication status and progress of sync state process:
 * Agent has fetched all active networks
 * Agent configure a network start and finish

Closes-Bug: #1535285

Change-Id: I517073e4a9a7a870cbbfd8cb0e14a7571176f562

deleted_lines: LOG.debug('Calling driver for network: %(net)s action: %(action)s', {'net': network.id, 'action': action})

commit_message:
Deprecated tox -downloadcache option removed

Caching is enabled by default from pip version 6.0

More info:
https://testrun.org/tox/latest/config.html#confval-downloadcache=path
https://pip.pypa.io/en/stable/reference/pip_install/#caching

Change-Id: Ie6370bf4beb9a5a1e67a7e2d430daf43f9b45301

commit_message:
Nova RPC unpinning

During upgrades, we only run Puppet on the whole deployment to converge
the state, after the upgrade workflow itself has been fully
completed. That is an opportunity to utilize Puppet to make sure Nova
Compute RPC doesn't remain pinned to the older version.

Change-Id: I6ebc813a80dfd9dfbbb213c38724487e044507b8

subject: Fix parsing of RabbitMQ logs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-26 13:58:34.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/common/templates/heka-rabbitmq.toml.j2', 'docker/heka/plugins/decoders/os_rabbitmq_log.lua'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kolla/commit/95cf542f8d5a28ae726b6864d61672982c645510', 'message': "Fix parsing of RabbitMQ logs

Currently Heka fails to parse the RabbitMQ logs. There are two
problems:

1. The rabbit-sasl.log file is ignored but the file_match expression
   does not match.
2. The delimiter used in the RegexSplitter makes Heka stop on the
   very first log entry. '\n\n(=[^=]+====' (with two \n's) is
   a better delimiter. deliver_incomplete_final is used to get the
   final log entry.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I94720340d5b2d6fd5d7641b9ff58733f6cd882ee
"}]
commit_message:
Fix parsing of RabbitMQ logs

Currently Heka fails to parse the RabbitMQ logs. There are two
problems:

1. The rabbit-sasl.log file is ignored but the file_match expression
   does not match.
2. The delimiter used in the RegexSplitter makes Heka stop on the
   very first log entry. '\n\n(=[^=]+====' (with two \n's) is
   a better delimiter. deliver_incomplete_final is used to get the
   final log entry.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I94720340d5b2d6fd5d7641b9ff58733f6cd882ee

commit_message:
Fix database mysql errors on non-primary controler

This change stops trying to manage the root user for
non-primary controllers as they already get a database with a root
password that isn't blank initially.

Change-Id: If3d497c281c1a402c68492afb1c638938d512804
Closes-Bug: #1548389

added_lines: if $primary_controller { Class['::galera'] -> Class['::osnailyfacter::mysql_access'] } else { # the subsequent mysql servers already have a root password changed so we # need to drop the .my.cnf in place prior to trying to set the root # password or we will fail Class['::cluster::mysql'] -> Class['::osnailyfacter::mysql_access'] -> Class['::mysql::server::root_password'] }

commit_message:
Add validation for 'retries' param in puppet task

Puppet tasks allow to specify 'retries' param to control
how many retries will be performed in case of problems with
puppet run. It should be validated to only allow integers.
Additionally added example of usage.

DocImpact
Change-Id: I60d192582eacb6561650c1a309d480128b172f7a
Closes-Bug: #1457794
Depends-On: I819a019cf488fc1bd0d52b35d1693fcc088125cb
(cherry picked from commit 6f771e69645fd7bd71ac1782e768fedd0c3e3e1c)

commit_message:
Prevent PD subnets with incorrect IPv6 modes

This patch prevents the creation of IPv6 Prefix Delegation enabled
subnets with any values other than slaac or dhcpv6-stateless for
ipv6_ra_mode and ipv6_address_mode.

Also includes new tests to prevent future regressions.

Change-Id: I2e3cd4dda185e478b0f97eb8511e64ad2b83a2cf
Closes-Bug: 1527000
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/54/258754/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: constants.DHCPV6_STATELESS]

commit_message:
Add release notes for senlin resources

Add release notes for senlin resources.

blueprint senlin-resources

Change-Id: I15f2316d7c625443152b97d7e028c5af22c0b4ce
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/53/282953/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - New resource ``OS::Senlin::Cluster`` is added to create a cluster in senlin. A cluster is a group of homogeneous nodes. - New resource ``OS::Senlin::Node`` is added to create a node in senlin. Node represents a physical object exposed by other OpenStack services. - New resource ``OS::Senlin::Receiver`` is added to create a receiver in senlin. Receiver can be used to hook the engine to some external event/alarm sources. - New resource ``OS::Senlin::Profile`` is added to create a profile in senlin. Profile is a module used for creating nodes, it's the definition of a node. - New resource ``OS::Senlin::Policy`` is added to create a policy in senlin. Policy is a set of rules that can be checked and/or enforced when an Action is performed on a Cluster.

commit_message:
fix _validate_shared_update for dvr router ports

When trying to update external network from shared to not,
_validate_shared_update will be called to validate ports
on external network to confirm that, except router ports,
there is no port from other tenants. If some other tenants
ports still exist on external network, shared attribute
updating will fail.

However, current _validate_shared_update will only ignore router
ports with device_owner such as DEVICE_OWNER_ROUTER_GW and
DEVICE_OWNER_FLOATINGIP when query ports, but indeed ports with
device_owner such as DEVICE_OWNER_AGENT_GW and DEVICE_OWNER_ROUTER_SNAT
should be skipped, otherwise an empty tenant_id like '' will cause
_validate_shared_update fails to work as expected.

Change-Id: Ibf5daf14192ce51d4e9ce10dc0c806ea230adec3
Closes-Bug: #1522482
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/55/253155/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: context, models_v2.Port).filter( and_( models_v2.Port.network_id == id, models_v2.Port.device_owner != constants.DEVICE_OWNER_ROUTER_GW, models_v2.Port.device_owner != constants.DEVICE_OWNER_FLOATINGIP))

commit_message:
Correct insufficient name for external process in manager log

Let's just make the log more precise.

But remember the inconsitent use of the ProcessManager:
The following external processes's ProcessManager
did not set the 'service' param:
1. HA router IP monitor
2. DHCP dnsmasq
3. keepalived(vrrp)
4. metadata-proxy

The following set:
1. dibbler
2. radvd

Change-Id: I93b742ff1e52f15e5541ef3e7c8e844c70e8dd6c
Closes-Bug: #1514728
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/48/243448/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: service=DNSMASQ_SERVICE_NAME,

commit_message:
Make simulator more asynchronous

We need to use eventlet.sleep() in green thread loops
in order to have more chances to switch between them.

Change-Id: I7c08e82182b68b95c36265d58df0644c5ce2c171

commit_message:
Distinguish postgres and plain user database host

The thing is that in many cases postgresql database
is configured so that depending on the way of
connection to the database (local or network)
database can use different authorization methods,
like peer, trust or md5.

This patch allows to distinguish database hosts
for postgres and plain users.

Change-Id: I24aac3ccd22cc7b05d4e5717dfcbbb7d4d19368a

commit_message:
Set 0644 file mode for volume content files

We need read rights for everyone to make regular user possible to
export system test environments without superuser privileges.
Also it helps to save time when older version of libvirt with poor
vol-download performance is used.

Change-Id: I18a973daf8d7b7ae5890100878df0d94635a6241
blueprint: environment-snapshot

commit_message:
Add VLAN tag info to port before applying SG initial setup.

Before the initial SG firewall setup, the VLAN tag is added to
the port information; this assignment is removed from _bind_devices
function. This value is needed by some SG agent
implementations.

This implementation mantains the actual function call order:
  - Apply security groups.
  - Bind devices.

Change-Id: Ib22abda80a269595c1bee38d7054f20e839f70cc
Closes-Bug: #1512636

commit_message:
Add api_paste type/provider for Ceilometer

Add ceilometer_api_paste_ini type/provider for Ceilometer.
Also add the capability to configure api-paste.ini with config.pp.

Change-Id: If68819b598fdb6cdf1b90532608b874fb46198df
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-ceilometer refs/changes/44/285344/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Puppet::Type.type(:ceilometer_api_paste_ini).provide( :ini_setting, :parent => Puppet::Type.type(:ini_setting).provider(:ruby) ) do def section resource[:name].split('/', 2).first end def setting resource[:name].split('/', 2).last end def separator '=' end def self.file_path '/etc/ceilometer/api-paste.ini' end # added for backwards compatibility with older versions of inifile def file_path self.class.file_path end end

commit_message:
Provide the option to specify a list of requirements when installing pip

This patch removes the current pip pin and changes the role to provide a way
for a consumer of the role to specify any requirements they want to in a
list.

This is a more generic facility and allows the consumer to specify the
requirements in a playbook or group vars instead of being forced to
override them as they're defaulted into this role.

Change-Id: I0a78135737c40a505d77df6ed67da0ef6695bfcb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-pip_install refs/changes/01/284701/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - "setuptools<20.2.1" - "wheel<0.29"

commit_message:
Add VLAN tag info to port before applying SG initial setup.

Before the initial SG firewall setup, the VLAN tag is added to
the port information; this assignment is removed from _bind_devices
function. This value is needed by some SG agent
implementations.

This implementation mantains the actual function call order:
  - Apply security groups.
  - Bind devices.

Change-Id: I6f70083a1d42a5be4545956406a96d6579145c00
Closes-Bug: #1512636

commit_message:
Deprecate 'force_gateway_on_subnet' option

Documentation changes associated with the deprecation
of 'force_gateway_on_subnet'.
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/277303/ is the patch
which deprecates the option.

neutron.conf.sample is generated by `tox -e genconfig` in neutron root.

Change-Id: If3b40992137074ef2ac3a0dcd7172ac8936fe96e
Closes-Bug: #1548466

commit_message:
Install: Revert errant patch for glance

Revert errant patch for glance [1] that changes 'wget' to
'curl' because it doesn't resolve a potential issue for
all distributions.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/281185/

Change-Id: I888910df3fc9a63243a6d2c2934c46ee3073ac0e
backport: Liberty

added_lines: $ wget http://download.cirros-cloud.net/0.3.4/cirros-0.3.4-x86_64-disk.img .. note:: Install ``wget`` if your distribution does not include it.

commit_message:
Pin wheel version in repo_server role

Currently, wheel 0.29.0 is being pulled in and this is building some
wheels that cannot be installed.  For example,
cffi-1.5.2-cp27-cp27mu-linux_x86_64.whl is being built but pip will
not install this.  Previously, when using 0.26.0, we were building
cffi-1.5.2-cp27-none-linux_x86_64.whl.

After chatting in #pypa, it was recommended to either downgrade wheel,
or upgrade pip >= 8.

Conflicts:
	playbooks/roles/repo_server/defaults/main.yml

Change-Id: Ic7a9d9992a88fcd93bd7c19fb7f5c907a7299b07
Closes-Bug: #1545505
(cherry picked from commit 926cc438ec057808a6d70c78ce6d5e7809db0dd1)

commit_message:
Remove Mirantis-specific code from fuel-web repo

Remove code related to registration in Mirantis tracking system and
using Mirantis server to collect statistics.

Change-Id: Ie1243a8b12368a0d61cd51da2d5ab6cce3eeea65
Related to blueprint remove-vendor-code
Depends-On: Id67d6201cb23e371dc42ec6e818bcbc2ca0fde31

subject: heat: manage heat user role before openrc
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-25 18:35:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-openstack-integration/commit/e6a539fc5394a9aeba86a969493a23262073d56d', 'message': 'heat: manage heat user role before openrc

When /root/openrc is present, Puppet catalog will try to use it.
Though to use openrc, we need the admin user role in place otherwise
authentification will fail.

This patch makes sure the right orchestration happens.

Change-Id: I3ba651de5b40c49ee851a525424fb934f7a2575a
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-02-25 22:25:49.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-openstack-integration/commit/7f11eaa8b2b70c7c6c7ec1d5f9b6bab4cb9a9f3e', 'message': 'heat: manage heat user role before openrc

When /root/openrc is present, Puppet catalog will try to use it.
Though to use openrc, we need the admin user role in place otherwise

commit_message:
heat: manage heat user role before openrc

When /root/openrc is present, Puppet catalog will try to use it.
Though to use openrc, we need the admin user role in place otherwise
authentification will fail.

This patch makes sure the right orchestration happens.

Depends-On: I8a5ba016fc788bda1cd3f3d7666a78ba219d3ed3
Change-Id: I3ba651de5b40c49ee851a525424fb934f7a2575a

commit_message:
Provide informative message for validation success

TOSCA-Parser gives errors if validation fail but for successful validation,
there is no message. Add one. Doing it separately for shell and osc as they
are having their own logic but in near future both will have a common class
not to repeat common logic and messages.

Change-Id: Ib531f315c29619ae033ce0ab13bc24adc3b90016
Closes-Bug: #1540595

commit_message:
Excessive messages logged during unit tests

The addition of a debug message in change 01ff9529
(01ff9529415ae46a5a8b2d3fa9981cb80e99cd5c) in
trove/guestagent/datastore/experimental/cassandra/service.py resulted
in unittests spewing the messages indicating that a logger was not
defined for trove.guestagent.datastore.experimental.cassandra.service.

Change-Id: I625b5b29a612531e8b9098fd0d8192c54d48526f
Closes-Bug: 1546861

commit_message:
Make metadata handling consistent in Object Store

Make metadata handling consistent across all Object Store resources.
The consistent methods are get_*_metdata, set_*_metadata, and
delete_*_metadata which is similar to the __get__, __set__, and
__delete__ methods of a descriptor or the __getitem__, __setitem__,
and __delitem__ of a MutableMapping so it should be fairly natural
for Python users.

Change-Id: Ie6a892b48ac63ef6a6832b66f9e65e1b5d8a6d76
Closes-Bug: #1487150

commit_message:
Basic resource.prop for ID attributes (block store)

This patch set updates all block store objects to use basic
properties for ID attributes. In particular, the following changes
were made:
  - Use basic *_id resource.prop for ID attributes
  - Clarify documentation for ID attributes
  - Revert https://github.com/openstack/python-openstacksdk/commit/8c7ca1e62e5a834fc5e04a95225ecb6ae7025e60

In addition, functional tests were added for the snapshot,
type and volume proxy interfaces.

Change-Id: Ica597e65a59fc054a8544cd6e5888528bf1d2a70
Partial-Bug: #1461200

subject: Fix rspec testing outside of the Openstack CI.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-26 13:03:18.000000000', 'files': ['functions'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-openstack-integration/commit/0de28fbab31a95b402b3c57d62495bb2e5207bbd', 'message': "Fix rspec testing outside of the Openstack CI.

When testing rspec locally the r10k binary is never found because the
GEM_BIN_DIR is wrongly set to GEM_HOME/bin.  GEM_HOME is set by bundler
and GEM_HOME/bin do not point where bundler put the binary.  The
binaries are handled by bundler by changing the PATH.  rbenv, use
similar tricks.

install_all is only used outside of the CI, so this modification
wouldn't change anything as far as the official CI is concerned.

Change-Id: I07668d64f9adf6713f5c267cf45650ba92ee0b9c
Closes-Bug: 1550331
"}]
commit_message:
Fix rspec testing outside of the Openstack CI.

When testing rspec locally the r10k binary is never found because the
GEM_BIN_DIR is wrongly set to GEM_HOME/bin.  GEM_HOME is set by bundler
and GEM_HOME/bin do not point where bundler put the binary.  The
binaries are handled by bundler by changing the PATH.  rbenv, use
similar tricks.

install_all is only used outside of the CI, so this modification
wouldn't change anything as far as the official CI is concerned.

Change-Id: I07668d64f9adf6713f5c267cf45650ba92ee0b9c
Closes-Bug: 1550331
